Short Summary

Collecting Donations for a great cause:  We will present the donation to the band/ which goes to cancer research/awareness/cure, the night of the reunion.

Short Summary
Collecting Donations for a great cause:  We will present the donation to the band/ which goes to cancer research/awareness/cure, the night of the reunion.

story:
I am a musician, singer, and dancer. I want to incorporate dance, pole, and aerial with live music and singing to create something unique that I haven't seen done before, and that expresses who I am and everything I love.

I've worked as a professional freelance musician for years. I've had wonderful experiences, but always as a 'hired gun,' and never my own project.

I've loved dance my whole life but have never combined it with anything I've done musically.

I've always loved the theatrical and wanted to perform live and create videos combining elements of costume and makeup, fantasy and visual art.

My recent experience with pole dancing, burlesque, and belly dancing has inspired me to put all of my passions together into something that I haven't seen done before and would be a thrilling challenge both creatively and personally.

 

My Story

I play violin, harp, piano, viola, guitar, and bass- classically trained from age 3.

I have played hundreds of projects professionally and expanded into jazz, blues, Irish fiddle, Piazzolla, gypsy and tango violin, pop, rock, and metal, bluegrass, and country.

(I may or may not be able to melt your face off shredding with distortion effects)

Because of the 'Flying V' shape of my electric violin, (no way to rest on your shoulder and grip under your chin) it has an attachment system that allows full mobility of the left arm. So I can occasionally release my left hand and could perform dance or pole routines, especially with the assistance of a partner.

 

What I Plan To Do

Create music utilizing all the elements I've developed and spans all the styles I love.

  • The first album of harp and violin favorites and duets (playing both harp and violin tracks) is already in the works (see Go Fund Me campaign for further detail)
  • I am singing my favorite jazz ballads for a vocal album with supporting tracks I play myself on harp, violin, piano, guitar, and bass. (not to be a gimmick, I'm just cheap labor) including 'My Funny Valentine,' 'Tenderly,' 'Willow Weep For Me,' 'Cry Me A River,' 'Gentle Rain,' 'Misty,' 'Round Midnight,' 'In A Sentimental Mood.'
  • I am also working on multi-track covers of songs including 'Sweet Child O Mine,' 'Barracuda,' 'Black Velvet,' 'Blister in the Sun,' 'Thunderstruck,' and 'Istanbul,' 'Cherry Pie,' 'Suicide Blonde,' 'Call Me.'
  • I would like to do an all-Debussy album featuring the string quartet, my own arrangement of Clair de Lune, and the vocal art song 'Beau Soir.'
  • I would like to do an album of 40's big band and jazz standards including 'But Not For Me,' Girl From Ipanema,' 'I Got Rhythm,' 'Begin the Beguine,' 'My Heart Belongs to Daddy' 

 

Create videos for songs from each album that incorporate dance and visual expression of what the music means to me

  • Ballet pole routine 'en pointe' to the beautiful and graceful 'Ave Maria' (original Bach on harp with Gounod's melody on violin)
  • Melancholy personal reflection playing Massenet's Meditation while wading into the sea, either to be engulfed by it or find peace. (or both...)
  • Argentine tango to 'Cry Me a River' (the jazz standard, not the pop song)
  • Contemporary dance and aerial routine to 'My Funny Valentine'
  • Burlesque pole routine to 'Harlem Nocturne' (look it up, it's sultry like something out of 'Sin City)
  • Cha Cha or Samba routine to 'Girl From Ipanema' (I sing it in Portugese, Bossa Nova style, not the Sinatra swing or style that's commonly thought of as elevator music)
  • Rhumba routine to 'Gentle Rain' (another latin flavored Bossa Nova)
  • Belly Dance routine to Shakira's 'Ojos Asi'
  • Pole routines to pop and metal covers (any number depending on royalty costs)

Create live performances

I would build up in scale with increased experience and funding, anywhere from street performing to eventually large venue shows.

I have been traveling and street performing to experiment with different venues and styles, even playing my pedal harp on Fremont Street in Las Vegas. 

I have also had fun setting up an amp with the electric violin and playing 'karaoke roulette' with passers-by who can connect their phone to my Bluetooth speaker and dare me to improvise along with any song of their choosing. 

 

I want to set up a mic, a guitar, and a bass and do this with a full band or use a karaoke system and allow anyone in the crowd who sings or plays to jump up and join in.

I could add pole routines with a portable stage pole like this one:

http://xpoleus.com/product/x-stage-lite-45mm-ch...

Eventually I would hope to do full stage shows with a cast of musicians, dancers, and aerialists.

 

Why Indiegogo:

1- I want to share this journey with others.

Any journey is better when you can celebrate milestones with those who want you to succeed, believe in the big dreams and creative drive that keeps you going in moments of discouragement, and provide inspiration with campaigns and journeys of their own.

2- I believe this is possible without the traditional structure of manager/agent/record label

I've watched the music industry evolve for the last several years working a corporate job (due to injury, couldn't play full time- long story I'll tell later) while still playing freelance enough to be around and watch the possibilities open up, see how others were forging careers in new ways. 

I gained invaluable experience in business and management, technology, accounting, tax and contract law, and studied up on entertainment law and copyrights on my own, audio recording, marketing, production and promotion, and any other skill I thought would help me venture into my own music endeavors. 

(That's not my Aston Martin- this is just to look like someone who's savvy in business)

3- I can't do this on my own. 

I don't think it's necessary to turn over creative control, but I certainly can't do everything myself, especially where it involves talents and abilities I don't have.

 

Why Now?

1- If I wait until I have a finished product to show people or involve anyone else, I will never get there. 

I could lock myself in a studio for a year to trainand work to have more to show you, but I think I'd be so starved for connection and collaboration my soul would shrivel. 

    2- I Need to commit and define my intentions --for myself.

    Sometimes it helps to put something into words and officially put it into the universe as a way of making it real for yourself.

    (I'll post a link to my blog about the personal journey of realizing I was holding back each time I tried to put my ideas into words.)

    It's time for me to face my fears, define what I want, put it out there, and commit myself.

     

    What I'm Raising Funds For:

    Choreography, videography, administrative and marketing costs, live show production, dancers and musicians, crew, and travel costs. 

    I am operating on a shoestring budget right now as I travel, experiment, and get my production company set up. I'm living in my car, which I consider an adventure (read: don't feel sorry for me, I actually love it) but eventually could use a bigger vehicle so all my instruments could come with me, and eventually other people.

    This really is my fantasy lifestyle (thus the name of the campaign) to travel constantly and explore the world while doing everything that I love. Eventually I would love to have a setup that would allow near-constant travel while creating new music and video along the way. (I will post more detail on this later)

    For now, I mainly need my own time free to devote as I set up the administrative side, record the music, and plan the initial videos and live shows.

    (I had significant savings going into the travel lifestyle but has depleted as my explorations evolved my idea of what I wanted to do)

    I am financing my first album separately (https://www.gofundme.com/2u377xo) and then will need a choreographer and dance partner plus videography for the first video.

     

    What I'm Offering Backers:

    • Advance sales of the album and singles
    • Advance screenings of videos
    • 'Panel' experiences- a chance to go into the studio with me, see the process and provide feedback via private Periscope channel. 
    • Live performance tickets
    • VIP backstage experiences, meet-and-greets, and post-concert jam sessions with the band!
    • Private performances, workshops, and bachelorette party nights out including pole class!
    • Launch parties, jam sessions, and promo events in fabulous, infamous Las Vegas! 
    • A Las Vegas New Year's party like no other, including the full weekend experience including VIP access to all performances and luxury accommodations.

    I figure I'm better off staying away from physical items that would need to be shipped, but if there are specific perks you would like to see, let me know, I'm open to suggestion.

    Why This Is Important To Me:

    My relationship with both music and dance have gotten somewhat fragmented. In order to make a living as a freelance musician, you don't pick the project or style of music, it's not a creative expression of YOU. I never want to argue with people who say 'Oh how awesome that you get to do what you love for a living,' and yet what pays money isn't necessarily the same as what I love about music. 

    On the other hand, I have loved dance my whole life but never been good enough to dance professionally. I enjoy it with the pure love of a fan, which has its own joy, and yet always the longing to be able to do the awe-inspiring things you see professionals doing. 

    I always figured I would venture into my own music projects as a way of reclaiming creativity and expression, and once I built enough of a career, I could 'get away with' doing videos involving some dance, and people would work with me because I would be the paying client. I didn't feel I could justify saying I wanted to do dance as a thing that I love to do.

    I realize how sad I would be if I wanted to dance and was told I just plain can't if I'm not good enough. That humbles me from looking down on anyone who wants to play music because they love it, even if they weren't trained to the skill level as was expected of me. 

    Music, dance, and all art should be something that speaks to our souls and expresses what words cannot. No one should be excluded. I've loved watching the dance shows that are more about the journey than showcasing pure skill. Not to say that we shouldn't strive for higher skill levels and refine crafts, but just so as to better express what the soul wants to use art to express, not as a ranking or qualification system.

    I want to face my own fears about feeling that I can be a dancer even if I'm not the best dancer, show others that they can too, and use my musical experience to build something that welcomes and includes all instead of judging, intimidating, or excluding anyone.

    Why I Believe This Has Value:

    Pole dancing in particular has had a profound impact on me. Aside from fears of not being good enough, I've had the struggle with body image issues that is a female's birthright in our society.

    Pole class was the most accepting, supportive environment I've ever experienced. The ballet style class was beautiful and expressive, and it was always emphasized that we should do each step in a way that felt right, make it our own. 

    I struggled with tricks and jumps due to arm injury (story for another day) but once I took the pole-esque (burlesque style) class, I had found 'my thing' and immediately bought my own pole.

    The music was sultry, the routines were sassy, and the lights were turned low. But there was nothing trashy about it, never for anyone else or about being an object. The students dressed in anything from sweats to full burlesque outfits, and all shapes, sizes, ages, and body types were represented and accepted equally. 

    I could suddenly feel legitimate (not just vain) in dressing in something sexy and dancing in my living room-- I was practicing my routine!! But then I wondered why I should need an excuse or feel vain for wanting to feel sexy. That seemed to imply that my sensuality and sexuality only existed for men. 

    I've realized it's the opposite of what one might think about pole dancing- and I want to show women that there is something so powerful about connecting with your own sensuality - not for anyone but yourself. 

    The ultimate in putting everything together is to feel like it would do some good in the world

    If I can build bridges and defy limitations of style in music, that would be fulfilling on its own. If I can inspire others in facing fears and body image issues, that is worth the vulnerability of stretching myself beyond my comfort zone. But it would be ultimately fulfilling if I can also show women, girls, and even men an expression of sensuality that is beautiful, creative, and empowering for its own sake and not for anyone else's benefit or approval. 

    I'm excited to be part of this community of creatives and innovators, and to share your journeys as well as my own. 

    You can scroll down for more of my story, musical examples, and inspirations behind my ideas.

    I'll also be blogging on my website musicadventuregirl.com.

    Cheers to the journey!!

     

    * Apologies to PayPal users, as I cannot accept PayPal on this platform. I can, however, accept donations and 'virtual tips' through a PayPal.me account under MusicAdventureGirl. I will also arrange to have tickets to jams and events available for purchase through my website store.

     

    Ways you can help me for FREE 

    #1- Share

    If you think what I'm doing is interesting, show it to anyone else who may think it's interesting! Help me build a network of people who want to share this journey with me!

    I will be having referral contests for shout-outs in custom songs and live streams.

    #2- Get FREE Stuff!!

    I utilize a lot of great services from amazing companies who offer referral bonus and credits. (brilliant win-win-win marketing strategy in my opinion, though that's another blog post)

    This is a great way for anyone to help me cover expenses- get around or stay when traveling, hire help with administrative work and event production.

    1- Take a Lyft

    Get yourself some free ride credit, and share this promo code with all your friends, too!

    https://www.lyft.com/invite/MUSICLOVER?route_ke...

    PROMO CODE: MUSICLOVER

    2- Take an Uber: 

    Get a free ride, help me get around when I'm traveling:

    CODE: TESSL412UE

    3- Book a trip through Airbnb

    If you haven't heard of it, you should check it out just because it's awesome. I love staying Airbnb when I travel and am planning to rent places when I do concerts or events in other cities. If you use my referral code, it will give me some credit to use for travel or events (as well as give you $35 off your first stay)

    https://www.airbnb.com/c/tessl80

    4- Hire an assistant through Task Rabbit

    This is a cool app that allows you to hire assistants for simple tasks, help with events or projects for an hour or a few hours. Get $20 off your first task and help me with $20 for hiring an assistant to help with media and event production.

    https://www.taskrabbit.com/social?ref=TRY2G7HH&...

    5- Rent a cool car or make money renting your car on Turo

    You won't find a Tesla, Corvette, or Porsche at most standard car rental places!

    https://turo.com/referral?code=1306733r1CDoH

    6- Get money back for online shopping through EBates

    This is pretty much the easiest way I've ever found to make money, since I buy everything online. Click through the browser add-on to buy whatever you buy, and they send you checks!

    https://www.ebates.com/r/LUNDTE2?eeid=28187

     

     

    Ideas I've Been Experimenting With:

     

    I recorded Bach's Ave Maria on harp, then played back the video of it and played along on violin.

     

    I can record multiple tracks in real time with a looper pedal

     

    I wanted to be able to create my own bass tracks, so I bought a bass. (this was day one of learning to play it)

    Here's the whole guitar solo from 'Sweet Child O Mine' and I'm not in performance mode because I was testing FX settings to see which sounded the best for each part of this. 

     

     

    More of My Story

    My family was very musical and extended family gatherings usually involved performing skits, musical numbers, and dance routines for each other. 

    I played some piano and then started violin training at age 3.

    (and don't I look SO thrilled about it?? haha)

     

    My training was strict but provided incredible opportunities.

    I competed from a young age, performed in a national tour at 10, played in a university orchestra at 12. I received scholarships, studied with amazing teachers at prestigious institutions, music festivals, string quartets and chamber ensembles. I soloed with orchestras, toured and competed internationally.

     

    I've had incredible experiences playing professionally, but it was never my project.

    I've performed and recorded extensively as a freelancer- live shows or albums for other artists, movie soundtracks, commercials, TV shows, cartoons, news theme songs, video game music, you name it. 

    My favorite is playing arena shows with rock stars/bands. Being on stage with that kind of energy, the lights and lasers and thousands of people cheering is incredible!

    I always felt restrained being 'string player #3' and having to say poised

    If they had a violinist in the band, I'd think "maybe I should be THAT person." But I wasn't sure what type of band I'd want to be in, which style if I had to pick one, or whether I should do my own thing. 

    I started formulating ideas....

    I had to stop playing full time due to an injury several years ago, so have been working at a corporate job, which has been valuable in learning business and management. I've watched the music industry evolve and I've taken notes while studying up on technology, accounting, tax and entertainment law.

    I acquired more instruments and 'toys,' tinkered with audio, effects systems, looper pedals and ways of playing along to tracks I'd recorded on a different instrument. 

    I've been going to blues nights and jazz jams, playing with various bands and experimenting with different styles.

    I've always wanted to incorporate dance and do videos.

    I always figured I would need to build a music career and then be able to incorporate some dance as part of it. At most, I hoped to work with great dancers if I could be the paying client hiring them to choreograph a video. Or maybe convince the pro dancers to join me if I ever got invited to perform as a musical guest on 'Dancing With The Stars.'

    I recently left my 'day job' to venture into my own thing.

    I've been traveling and street performing, finding the local bars where musicians gather and play in any city. I've experimented with different styles and collaborations, and I've had a great time doing all of this. 

    Everyone told me I needed to solidify my style and pick a 'niche' in order to be successful, but I could never narrow down one style I loved most or that represented all sides of me. I was more interested in learning MORE styles, meeting street performers and learning from them, going to the local jam joint in each city rather than put on a performance showcasing what I did.

    But it's only so fun if I'm trying to do everything myself. For learning purposes or cheap labor, it's fine, but now I really want to be able to collaborate and involve other musicians. I just won't accept the concept of having to be limited to one style.

    And as much as I love the adventure of living in my car and being a traveling free spirit, it's crowded in my car with all my instruments and difficult to train with nowhere to put them all, let alone set up my pole.

    As I've had to rethink my plan as funds ran low and I was moving farther from a place where I could launch something that would pay the bills, I've started peeling back additional layers and realized that I wouldn't care about any project if it only represented a small fraction of me. I decided I'd rather go back to a day job than compromise in order to play into what was more sure to 'catch on,' and become financially successful. 

    The more I peeled back these layers, I found fears surrounding dance and realized that it would be terrifying to go for my ultimate dream without the buffer of success, but it would be the only way it would be authentic enough.

    And so here I am, looking for a network of people who support rather than discourage big dreams.

     

     

    My Inspirations:

    I would love to do a tango like this playing violin:

     

    I would love to do the violin/harp duet to a modern pole routine like this one:

     

    This inspired me to sign up for pole classes:

     

    This is my pole-esque teacher, Angela Nelson- current national champion in Pole Sport, and incredible vixen! 

     

    This is my belly dance (and pole) teacher, Michelle Sorensen- her physique, movement, and control are endlessly mesmerizing and awe-inspiring!

     
     

    More of My Plan - Logistics:

    (Simplified version- I'll post  more detail)

    • Base my production company in Las Vegas where there's a huge pool of talent and performance opportunities
    • Set up studio space and administrative infrastructure
    • Train, rehearse, arrange, choreograph
    • Record and produce music 

    -distribution via digital download only through my own website and at no cost through Amazon Prime Music

    -First album is already underway and will be finished by January

    -Second album is in pre-production due to start recording in late November

    • Film videos for singles (1-3 per month depending on scale)
    • Social media network marketing (more detail to come- numerous linked platforms)
    • Jam session launch parties as singles, videos, and albums are released
    • Share, brainstorm and collaborate via the social media network as the creative process unfolds
    • Try out ideas, gain performance experience, and solicit feedback via street performing and live streaming jam sessions and rehearsals
    • Produce small shows early 2017 on the west coast with small cast and crew, low production costs and a shoestring travel budget 
    • Share and learn from this experience, plan and prepare for a bigger version
    • Produce more music and videos
    • Produce a bigger show for a tour in 2018
     

    Immediate Plan & What I Need:

    I don't need all that much funding to start, and I'm planning fun events along the way. Hopefully once it's off the ground, each venture will finance the next. 

    I mainly need 4 things right now:

    1. My own time to devote to this without working full time to pay bills, especially with administrative demands and building a social media network 
    2. Administrative costs- minimal, a few hundred to register my production company and pay for a business license, accounting apps, marketing materials
    3. Studio space to train and rehearse- I need enough studio for both dance rehearsals and and all my instruments.

    4. Photography and video- whether it's hiring assistants through Task Rabbit to help sort the thousands of pictures and videos I have in numerous places on various devices or hiring photographers for better photos to share along the way, and ultimately videographers and editors for the videos- this is where I have the most need.

    Later I will need funding for travel, musicians and sound engineers, choreographers, dancers, concert and event production. But again, I hope that if I can start creating, doing, and producing and performing, each step will raise the funds for the next.

A Las Vegas New Year's party like no other, including the full weekend experience including VIP access to all performances and luxury accommodations.
I figure I'm better off staying away from physical items that would need to be shipped, but if there are specific perks you would like to see, let me know, I'm open to suggestion.Why This Is Important To Me:My relationship with both music and dance have gotten somewhat fragmented. In order to make a living as a freelance musician, you don't pick the project or style of music, it's not a creative expression of YOU. I never want to argue with people who say 'Oh how awesome that you get to do what you love for a living,' and yet what pays money isn't necessarily the same as what I love about music. On the other hand, I have loved dance my whole life but never been good enough to dance professionally. I enjoy it with the pure love of a fan, which has its own joy, and yet always the longing to be able to do the awe-inspiring things you see professionals doing. I always figured I would venture into my own music projects as a way of reclaiming creativity and expression, and once I built enough of a career, I could 'get away with' doing videos involving some dance, and people would work with me because I would be the paying client. I didn't feel I could justify saying I wanted to do dance as a thing that I love to do.I realize how sad I would be if I wanted to dance and was told I just plain can't if I'm not good enough. That humbles me from looking down on anyone who wants to play music because they love it, even if they weren't trained to the skill level as was expected of me. Music, dance, and all art should be something that speaks to our souls and expresses what words cannot. No one should be excluded. I've loved watching the dance shows that are more about the journey than showcasing pure skill. Not to say that we shouldn't strive for higher skill levels and refine crafts, but just so as to better express what the soul wants to use art to express, not as a ranking or qualification system.I want to face my own fears about feeling that I can be a dancer even if I'm not the best dancer, show others that they can too, and use my musical experience to build something that welcomes and includes all instead of judging, intimidating, or excluding anyone.Why I Believe This Has Value:Pole dancing in particular has had a profound impact on me. Aside from fears of not being good enough, I've had the struggle with body image issues that is a female's birthright in our society.Pole class was the most accepting, supportive environment I've ever experienced. The ballet style class was beautiful and expressive, and it was always emphasized that we should do each step in a way that felt right, make it our own. I struggled with tricks and jumps due to arm injury (story for another day) but once I took the pole-esque (burlesque style) class, I had found 'my thing' and immediately bought my own pole.The music was sultry, the routines were sassy, and the lights were turned low. But there was nothing trashy about it, never for anyone else or about being an object. The students dressed in anything from sweats to full burlesque outfits, and all shapes, sizes, ages, and body types were represented and accepted equally. I could suddenly feel legitimate (not just vain) in dressing in something sexy and dancing in my living room-- I was practicing my routine!! But then I wondered why I should need an excuse or feel vain for wanting to feel sexy. That seemed to imply that my sensuality and sexuality only existed for men. I've realized it's the opposite of what one might think about pole dancing- and I want to show women that there is something so powerful about connecting with your own sensuality - not for anyone but yourself. The ultimate in putting everything together is to feel like it would do some good in the worldIf I can build bridges and defy limitations of style in music, that would be fulfilling on its own. If I can inspire others in facing fears and body image issues, that is worth the vulnerability of stretching myself beyond my comfort zone. But it would be ultimately fulfilling if I can also show women, girls, and even men an expression of sensuality that is beautiful, creative, and empowering for its own sake and not for anyone else's benefit or approval. I'm excited to be part of this community of creatives and innovators, and to share your journeys as well as my own. You can scroll down for more of my story, musical examples, and inspirations behind my ideas.I'll also be blogging on my website musicadventuregirl.com.Cheers to the journey!! * Apologies to PayPal users, as I cannot accept PayPal on this platform. I can, however, accept donations and 'virtual tips' through a PayPal.me account under MusicAdventureGirl. I will also arrange to have tickets to jams and events available for purchase through my website store. Ways you can help me for FREE #1- ShareIf you think what I'm doing is interesting, show it to anyone else who may think it's interesting! Help me build a network of people who want to share this journey with me!I will be having referral contests for shout-outs in custom songs and live streams.#2- Get FREE Stuff!!I utilize a lot of great services from amazing companies who offer referral bonus and credits. (brilliant win-win-win marketing strategy in my opinion, though that's another blog post)This is a great way for anyone to help me cover expenses- get around or stay when traveling, hire help with administrative work and event production.1- Take a LyftGet yourself some free ride credit, and share this promo code with all your friends, too!https://www.lyft.com/invite/MUSICLOVER?route_ke...PROMO CODE: MUSICLOVER2- Take an Uber: Get a free ride, help me get around when I'm traveling:CODE: TESSL412UE3- Book a trip through Airbnb
If you haven't heard of it, you should check it out just because it's awesome. I love staying Airbnb when I travel and am planning to rent places when I do concerts or events in other cities. If you use my referral code, it will give me some credit to use for travel or events (as well as give you $35 off your first stay)https://www.airbnb.com/c/tessl804- Hire an assistant through Task Rabbit
This is a cool app that allows you to hire assistants for simple tasks, help with events or projects for an hour or a few hours. Get $20 off your first task and help me with $20 for hiring an assistant to help with media and event production.https://www.taskrabbit.com/social?ref=TRY2G7HH&...5- Rent a cool car or make money renting your car on TuroYou won't find a Tesla, Corvette, or Porsche at most standard car rental places!https://turo.com/referral?code=1306733r1CDoH6- Get money back for online shopping through EBatesThis is pretty much the easiest way I've ever found to make money, since I buy everything online. Click through the browser add-on to buy whatever you buy, and they send you checks!https://www.ebates.com/r/LUNDTE2?eeid=28187  Ideas I've Been Experimenting With: I recorded Bach's Ave Maria on harp, then played back the video of it and played along on violin. I can record multiple tracks in real time with a looper pedal I wanted to be able to create my own bass tracks, so I bought a bass. (this was day one of learning to play it)Here's the whole guitar solo from 'Sweet Child O Mine' and I'm not in performance mode because I was testing FX settings to see which sounded the best for each part of this.   More of My StoryMy family was very musical and extended family gatherings usually involved performing skits, musical numbers, and dance routines for each other. I played some piano and then started violin training at age 3.(and don't I look SO thrilled about it?? haha) My training was strict but provided incredible opportunities.I competed from a young age, performed in a national tour at 10, played in a university orchestra at 12. I received scholarships, studied with amazing teachers at prestigious institutions, music festivals, string quartets and chamber ensembles. I soloed with orchestras, toured and competed internationally. I've had incredible experiences playing professionally, but it was never my project.I've performed and recorded extensively as a freelancer- live shows or albums for other artists, movie soundtracks, commercials, TV shows, cartoons, news theme songs, video game music, you name it. My favorite is playing arena shows with rock stars/bands. Being on stage with that kind of energy, the lights and lasers and thousands of people cheering is incredible!I always felt restrained being 'string player #3' and having to say poisedIf they had a violinist in the band, I'd think "maybe I should be THAT person." But I wasn't sure what type of band I'd want to be in, which style if I had to pick one, or whether I should do my own thing. I started formulating ideas....I had to stop playing full time due to an injury several years ago, so have been working at a corporate job, which has been valuable in learning business and management. I've watched the music industry evolve and I've taken notes while studying up on technology, accounting, tax and entertainment law.I acquired more instruments and 'toys,' tinkered with audio, effects systems, looper pedals and ways of playing along to tracks I'd recorded on a different instrument. I've been going to blues nights and jazz jams, playing with various bands and experimenting with different styles.I've always wanted to incorporate dance and do videos.I always figured I would need to build a music career and then be able to incorporate some dance as part of it. At most, I hoped to work with great dancers if I could be the paying client hiring them to choreograph a video. Or maybe convince the pro dancers to join me if I ever got invited to perform as a musical guest on 'Dancing With The Stars.'I recently left my 'day job' to venture into my own thing.I've been traveling and street performing, finding the local bars where musicians gather and play in any city. I've experimented with different styles and collaborations, and I've had a great time doing all of this. Everyone told me I needed to solidify my style and pick a 'niche' in order to be successful, but I could never narrow down one style I loved most or that represented all sides of me. I was more interested in learning MORE styles, meeting street performers and learning from them, going to the local jam joint in each city rather than put on a performance showcasing what I did.But it's only so fun if I'm trying to do everything myself. For learning purposes or cheap labor, it's fine, but now I really want to be able to collaborate and involve other musicians. I just won't accept the concept of having to be limited to one style.And as much as I love the adventure of living in my car and being a traveling free spirit, it's crowded in my car with all my instruments and difficult to train with nowhere to put them all, let alone set up my pole.As I've had to rethink my plan as funds ran low and I was moving farther from a place where I could launch something that would pay the bills, I've started peeling back additional layers and realized that I wouldn't care about any project if it only represented a small fraction of me. I decided I'd rather go back to a day job than compromise in order to play into what was more sure to 'catch on,' and become financially successful. The more I peeled back these layers, I found fears surrounding dance and realized that it would be terrifying to go for my ultimate dream without the buffer of success, but it would be the only way it would be authentic enough.And so here I am, looking for a network of people who support rather than discourage big dreams.  My Inspirations:I would love to do a tango like this playing violin: I would love to do the violin/harp duet to a modern pole routine like this one: This inspired me to sign up for pole classes: This is my pole-esque teacher, Angela Nelson- current national champion in Pole Sport, and incredible vixen!  This is my belly dance (and pole) teacher, Michelle Sorensen- her physique, movement, and control are endlessly mesmerizing and awe-inspiring!  
More of My Plan - Logistics:
(Simplified version- I'll post  more detail)

Base my production company in Las Vegas where there's a huge pool of talent and performance opportunities
Set up studio space and administrative infrastructure
Train, rehearse, arrange, choreograph
Record and produce music 

-distribution via digital download only through my own website and at no cost through Amazon Prime Music
-First album is already underway and will be finished by January
-Second album is in pre-production due to start recording in late November

Film videos for singles (1-3 per month depending on scale)
Social media network marketing (more detail to come- numerous linked platforms)
Jam session launch parties as singles, videos, and albums are released
Share, brainstorm and collaborate via the social media network as the creative process unfolds
Try out ideas, gain performance experience, and solicit feedback via street performing and live streaming jam sessions and rehearsals
Produce small shows early 2017 on the west coast with small cast and crew, low production costs and a shoestring travel budget 
Share and learn from this experience, plan and prepare for a bigger version
Produce more music and videos
Produce a bigger show for a tour in 2018

 

Immediate Plan & What I Need:
I don't need all that much funding to start, and I'm planning fun events along the way. Hopefully once it's off the ground, each venture will finance the next. 
I mainly need 4 things right now:


My own time to devote to this without working full time to pay bills, especially with administrative demands and building a social media network 

Administrative costs- minimal, a few hundred to register my production company and pay for a business license, accounting apps, marketing materials

Studio space to train and rehearse- I need enough studio for both dance rehearsals and and all my instruments.
Photography and video- whether it's hiring assistants through Task Rabbit to help sort the thousands of pictures and videos I have in numerous places on various devices or hiring photographers for better photos to share along the way, and ultimately videographers and editors for the videos- this is where I have the most need.

Later I will need funding for travel, musicians and sound engineers, choreographers, dancers, concert and event production. But again, I hope that if I can start creating, doing, and producing and performing, each step will raise the funds for the next.

story:
Snow was falling outside.

We were sitting at a fireplace, drinking whiskey. Alex sipped everything that was left in his wineglass, slightly exhaled and looked at our friends that were laughing warmly. Coal was slowly smoldering. You  might know that feeling of honesty which fills up your heart when you spend time with people you love and respect. You can talk about anything you want because not only they will understand you, but feel everything you are trying to express. 

But how can we preserve all that kindness, warmth and comfort? How can we preserve all those moments? We believe that music is the best may to express feelings and by creating our album we were able to conserve them forever.

We hadn't had any kind of cooperation before we wrote Through Silence, but we are convinced that you will love the music we have created.

There are 11 songs in the album written in just 2 months. Also we are writing songs for our next installment. 

We have also uploaded 3 of our songs to SoundCloud for you to enjoy :

https://soundcloud.com/david-kavazi/ex-ante

https://soundcloud.com/david-kavazi/cinder-for-honor-for-honor-tribute

https://soundcloud.com/david-kavazi/ill-bring-you-down

With the money we gather we will:

1) Record the whole album

2) Hold a debut concert (In Moscow)

Why cinder? 

Because cinder represents a live, flameless coal, an ember that fills you heart and body with heat.

Why Through Silence? 

Only in silence one can hear music that plays inside of him.

Some of our other songs:

Palindrome

 
Cafe d'Azur
 
Dolphins (Tapping)
 

 

Perseids

 

Firefly

 

Dedication

 

Squad:

Alex Kestner

Composer, multiinstrumentalist.

https://www.facebook.com/alexey.chuksin.5?fref=ts

 

David Kavazi

Singer, songwriter

https://www.facebook.com/wolffromgeo

story:
OUR STORY:

Based out of Galway (Ireland), international rock duo project Bursting Wonderland rose from Ania Chmielewska and Mimmo Ripa fusion of ideas and music personalities.  She was born and raised in Poland. Since teenager was singing here and there for years...

After she moved to Ireland and met Mimmo in person (they had already ongoing friendship relation through social media previous to that), Anna was even more motivated to start a band.

Mimmo however was already an experienced musician. Born and raised in Italy, living in Ireland for a decade at that time, had recorded many albums with various formations and bands in the past and in both countries, currently was working on promoting his first solo album with "Aboutmeemo". At first he was reluctant and didn't want to get involved into new project, especially with lack of serious musicians. He wanted to challenge himself in being an artistic producer of the whole project, rather than be responsible for songwriting only.

​It's important for us to share with you that first 6 songs of this
 album were created in literary 6 meetings. Every time we met for
practice, we were leaving with a song. So after 2 months we went to
 studio, so happy and excited (it was Anna's first time) and
 unfortunately the level of ignorance and unprofessionalism we
 encountered there was jeopardizing the recording big time. So many
 arrangements and ideas were lost or compromised and in the middle of
recording we had to put a stop to this treatment in order to save the
 album. We went to another studio sharing our horrible experience and
 hoping that we will be able to finally finish the album in
 professional environment. We got unlucky again. We spent few thousands
euro for recording in spartan conditions, constantly interrupted by
 sound engineers talking about their private life, eating, cooking,
 taking phone calls, even having band practice and making us wait for
 him to finish in the middle of our recording!!! Therefore the usual
 super lay back attitude and philosophy that its the seed of
procrastination, approximation and drop of quality, and all that
 coming with costs up the roof. It's hard to describe really what we went through and it's a miracle indeed that this album is finished. It's not at all what we had in
 mind, but at some point we were just aiming to save those beautiful
 songs, that came to us organically and naturally and we decided to
 compromise big time. That's why the title. David vs Goliath. It was a
 tough fight. But we didn't give up and we are here to tell our story
 and keep fighting. Some people in a very generalized way boast of
 great reputation worldwide and its hard to debunk without getting
 trashed. The key for many is: don't break our bubbles, but we are
 Bursting Wonderland and we speak our minds by what appears in front of
 our eyes!

These 10 songs tell about these struggles, also they are speaking about love, art, fake urban myths debunking, spirituality and politic at same time.

 

SUCCESS SO FAR:
 

One of our songs "In Memory Of" that tells true tragic love story of Ania's grandma (give it a listen on Spotify), is on stand by to be pitched to Witcher Season 2. YES! It's so good! Keep your fingers crossed for us! 

We recently signed with M&O label who have some famous names under their wings like Max Cavalera of Sepultura and Soulfly or Chloe Trujillo (wife of Metallica's bass player Robert). We are so happy to be on their team, yet they don't cover any costs, in fact we need to pay fees for them to promote us, so we really need your support.

 Mimmo has his side solo project "Aboutmeemo" and second album in works and you can check  out his newest single "Circus Mantra" ABOUTMEEMO- Circus Mantra - YouTube. As unsigned artist he does everything from songwriting, to recording all instruments and vocals (apart drums), he's artistic producer and his own manager and sponsor. Sure it's hard, but he will keep delivering this beautiful music at all cost, no matter the challenges!

That's his YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0z5uFs2OhJSPu...

Facebook: www.facebook.com/aboutmeemo 

Instagram: www.instagram.com/aboutmeemo

Bandcamp: www.aboutmeemo.bandcamp.com

Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/1CDWDB60qOCXTZs...

Website: www.aboutmeemo.com

We belong to MERF. MMG is a Nashville based Music Publishing Company. Specializing in songwriter & artist development, consultation, songwriter management, publishing opportunities and song plugging services. Of course this too has it's price, but it gives opportunity for our music to be pitched for biggest Hollywood productions from Marvel to Bruce Willis or Angelina Jolie hottest movies and much more! 

As you see the potential we believe in, it's verified by the fact, that we are good enough to be considered for worldwide exposure through soundtracks. Our persistence manifest in every step we take, every decision, every song and every fee we have to pay in order to break through to the other side, be known and heard. Not because we are hungry for fame, but because we believe in our music and we want you to enjoy it for yourselves and be your own soundtrack for your happiest and saddest times. We are here for You!  

 

COSTS WE HAD:

We spent approx. so far: 

Recording: 2000e

Mix and Mastering: 1500e

Session drummer: 2000e

Graphic designer and artwork work: 500e

2 video clip: 2000e ( first low budget. second with video maker and actors)

COSTS TO COME:

3rd video: 1000e

1000 digipack physical copies and some more merch as t-shirts: 1000e

Promo agency M&O label fees: 1500e

 

PERKS:

If you guys will purchase the perk and drop us your address, we will post our album to you wherever in the world you are, as soon as we will print it out. The cost is only 10 euro including postage.

 

YOUR IMPACT:

Every donation will make a difference in our current situation . We dedicated everything we had and more in order to share with world our music. We are certain that if we will keep pushing, sooner or later you will hear about us, because our music, our passion and our dedication to this project is extraordinary and we won't stop until we make it! 


If you can't contribute financially, please share our campaign and our music.

Listen to our album on Spotify: https://backl.ink/143779977

Subscribe to our YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgRZ6woQs41bdj...

Like our page on Facebook: www.facebook.com/burstingwonderland

Instagram: www.instagram.com/burstingwonderland

Bandcamp: https://burstingwonderland.bandcamp.com/

Reverbnation: https://www.reverbnation.com/burstingwonderland

Visit our website: www.burstingwonderland.com

story:
Not So Fat Records Presents: Bands Against Bigotry

If there is one thing everyone can agree on is that 2020 was, in short, a complete dumpster fire. Between a pandemic and civil unrest due to grave injustices we at Not So Fat Records decided that we needed to take a stand the best way we know how, through music.

That is why we are here asking for your help. We have put together a compilation album of Bands Against Bigotry. The purpose of this album is to connect bands who are anti- racist, pro lgbtqia+, pro feminism with each other but also with the public.

It’s our goal to fund and release this compilation album as well as to release other volumes in the future. We also hope to create future tours and festivals with contributing bands when touring and live music are feasible.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

We are looking to raise a minimum of $25,000 through this campaign in order to completely fund the first production of the Double LP Vinyl, CDs, T-Shirts, and Posters. The funding will also cover the shipping materials needed to get this great stuff to you. Any extra funding will go to second printings, artist compensation, and funding towards future volumes and tour funding.

So, what do you get out of this you may be wondering? Well, there are a lot of options. This compilation’s first print will be EXCLUSIVELY through Indiegogo. If you want the album to be made, then you’ll have to order. We’ve got packages as simple as a t-shirt, cd, or double lp vinyl to ultimate fan package where you get all of these things plus a shout out included inside the CD insert. We also have corporate sponsorship and supporting act sponsorships available as well.

If we don’t reach our goal we unfortunately we won’t be able to release this amazing compilation and the funds will be returned to those who participated in our fundraising.

The Impact

While it may not seem like a really cool compilation album is making a difference in society we strongly believe it does. Music is a common thread that stitches us all together. We hope that by bringing bands together who share similar values we can impact the music scene and world for the better.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that times are tough financially for many of us right now and we get it; there are other ways you can help us reach our goal. Follow and share us on social media, recommend us to your friends, family, coworkers, wherever. Every like and share helps us reach our goal!'

story_txt:
Not So Fat Records Presents: Bands Against Bigotry
If there is one thing everyone can agree on is that 2020 was, in short, a complete dumpster fire. Between a pandemic and civil unrest due to grave injustices we at Not So Fat Records decided that we needed to take a stand the best way we know how, through music.
That is why we are here asking for your help. We have put together a compilation album of Bands Against Bigotry. The purpose of this album is to connect bands who are anti- racist, pro lgbtqia+, pro feminism with each other but also with the public.
It’s our goal to fund and release this compilation album as well as to release other volumes in the future. We also hope to create future tours and festivals with contributing bands when touring and live music are feasible.
What We Need & What You Get
Break it down for folks in more detail:
We are looking to raise a minimum of $25,000 through this campaign in order to completely fund the first production of the Double LP Vinyl, CDs, T-Shirts, and Posters. The funding will also cover the shipping materials needed to get this great stuff to you. Any extra funding will go to second printings, artist compensation, and funding towards future volumes and tour funding.
So, what do you get out of this you may be wondering? Well, there are a lot of options. This compilation’s first print will be EXCLUSIVELY through Indiegogo. If you want the album to be made, then you’ll have to order. We’ve got packages as simple as a t-shirt, cd, or double lp vinyl to ultimate fan package where you get all of these things plus a shout out included inside the CD insert. We also have corporate sponsorship and supporting act sponsorships available as well.
If we don’t reach our goal we unfortunately we won’t be able to release this amazing compilation and the funds will be returned to those who participated in our fundraising.
The Impact
While it may not seem like a really cool compilation album is making a difference in society we strongly believe it does. Music is a common thread that stitches us all together. We hope that by bringing bands together who share similar values we can impact the music scene and world for the better.
Other Ways You Can Help
We know that times are tough financially for many of us right now and we get it; there are other ways you can help us reach our goal. Follow and share us on social media, recommend us to your friends, family, coworkers, wherever. Every like and share helps us reach our goal!'

story:
A Little Bit About Me

My name is Steven S. Safak.

I have been writing rap almost every single day since I was 8 years old.

I was studio-active by age 21 but stage fright stopped my music career dead in it's tracks.

I have hundreds of original songs & album concepts memorized photographically.

As an artist I go by 'Shel' & I've been on every streaming platform as 'Shel the Rapper' since 2012.

That's what I do - I'm a rapper, I rap.

I always have.

I started writing poetry in 3rd grade after my mom was killed by 4 years of cancer treatments.

It was the only way I could express my emotions.

After crushing a Hip Hop Festival performance on the west coast in 2019, I'm going all-in on my dream of making incredible rap music 24/7.

And I will document every detail for you, but I need your help.

Your donation is just the beginning.

I have some really big eyes on my stuff - let's take this all the way.

What I Need

Here is what I need in order to get rolling at full speed.

Once we hit these goals, I will secure funding & you can enjoy my fresh creations for the rest of your life.

  • $3,000 - studio time, beats, mixing, mastering, & distribution to complete my second full-length project "Alabaster Salamander" (13 tracks scheduled for release 10/31/20210)
  • $3,000 - videographer & video editor to create music videos for 3 tracks from Alabaster Salamander: "Pallbearer," "Fake Deaths," & "Balance feat. John Wells"
  • $2,000 - travel expenses & videographer for an east coast tour where I'll create content & music with other local legends including 'Limbless Rapper' Doug Moore
  • $2,000 - legal fees & attorney retainer when securing investor or indie label funding 
  • $2,000 - website, systems, & tech

The order of importance is finishing the album > the videos > the collabs > getting funding > building out a website.

I will take your money as far as I can <3

 

What You Get

I am so, so grateful to everyone who supports me.

Please accept these gifts as my way of saying thanks.

Every tier includes ALL the previous tier rewards :))

  • $10: Digital Download of "The Early Years" by Shel the Rapper (13 Tracks)
  • $20: Digital Download of "Chronic" Official Music Video by Shel the Rapper
  • $40: I Will Tear Out & Mail You a Real, Autographed Page from My Rhyme Notebook
  • $80: I Will Shout Out Your Name or Social Media Handle in a Daily Rap Video
  • $160: 20-Minute Zoom Call with Me to Talk About Whatever
  • $320: I Will Shout Out Your Name or Handle On One Song from "Alabaster Salamander"
  • $640: I Will Promote Your Brand or Offer On One Song from "Alabaster Salamander"
  • $1,280: Come to My Studio, Conceptualize a Song with Me, Record it Together, & Get 50% Songwriter Royalties for the Rest of Your Life!!!

 

 

The Impact

Baltimore City's Music scene needs a major overhaul:

  • Folks are obsessed with competing instead of collaborating
  • Great art comes from teamwork & healthy communities
  • Your donation helps me show my peers a better way

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Being broke is temporary; being poor is a mindset.

If you aren't able to contribute, please consider helping in other ways.

  • Share this link with anyone & everyone you know who likes rap music
  • Click the Social Media "Share" buttons on this page - it takes one second!

story:
RED HOT CHILI PEPPERS CONCERT IN CORNWALL


We are starting a campaign to bring the Red Hot Chili Peppers to Cornwall for a very special Concert, in return for your pledge you will receive a ticket to this potentially once in a lifetime gig.
The amount we are requesting is the amount required to secure the band, date and venue.
Once we have ensured the concert can go ahead a promotions company will take over and sell any remaining tickets, corporate sponsorship and concession stands. 
We are currently looking at several possible locations all within the Truro area exact location will be booked once campaign is over and we know which one will best suit demand and ticket sales.
This is a fixed campaign and if the money needed is not raised then nothing is paid it's an all or nothing campaign that you control, please like,  look and share and this can happen. 
The Chili Peppers are currently secretly recording a new album and if all goes well we will be hoping to secure a date for the later part of 2015 but the exact date will be confirmed directly after the campaign has met it's target.
Once a ticket has been purchased please supply your e mail address when completing, we will then add you to our mailing list so we can keep you Informed via a weekly newsletter 

If you have any questions, want to volunteer as a helper or enquire about a trade concession  please don't hesitate to mail on

Jonwilliams1975@yahoo.com

Thank you for looking, please like, share and invite and help make this a reality

story:
Présentation détaillée du projet

 

"Notre époque ne fait plus de musique.

  Elle camoufle par du bruit la solitude des hommes

  en leur donnant à entendre

  ce qu'elle croit être de la musique"

                                                                      (Jacques Attali)

 

"Où le coeur n'est pas, il ne saurait y avoir de musique"

                                                                      (Piotr Ilitch Tchaïkovsky)

 

"Sans la musique, la vie serait une erreur" 

                                                                      (Nietzsche)

 

 

Le projet :

Un premier CD des "Monstres & Chimères" est sorti chez Musea Records (société très connue, spécialisée dans le rock progressif, new-age, dream,... qui réédite entre autre Pink Floyd, Magma, Pulsar,...).

 

Le projet consiste à financer la sortie du second volume. Vous trouverez les titres repris dans les 2 volumes dans les images de pochettes ci-dessous.

Le thème de ce second opus concerne toujours la mythologie au sens large du terme, mais avec un bestiaire mieux connu que dans le premier volume : Djinns, zombies, Kraken, Sirène et loup-garou sont réunis dans le projet qui vous est proposé.

 

Comme vous pourrez l'entendre, la musique est inspirée de mes pères spirituels, à savoir : Jean-Michel Jarre, Vangelis, Klaus Schulze (ancien membre de Tangerine Dream), Tangerine Dream lui-même et Andreas Vollenweider pour les principaux.

 

Quelques morceaux en apéritif :

Afin de vous faire une idée du contenu du projet, voici quelques compositions. Je vous en souhaite une bonne écoute, en espérant que cela vous plaise. Les autres morceaux se retrouveront sur le CD pour lequel je requière votre aide au financement. Inutile de vous dire que ce projet me tient fort à coeur, c'est un peu comme un bébé qui arrive en fin de gestation et qui est prêt à naître. Il ne manque plus que vous comme médecins accoucheurs, sages-femmes,...

https://soundcloud.com/mystair-1/sets/monstres-chimeres-2

 

Petit historique du projet :

Tout a commencé en 2005, lorsque j'ai pris contact par hasard en surfant sur le web, avec la société Musea Records basée à Metz qui, suite à l'envoi de la maquette du CD des "Monstres & Chimères" (Volume 1), m'a proposé de l'éditer et de le commercialiser.

Voici les pistes qui se trouvent sur le premier CD :

https://soundcloud.com/mystair-1/sets/monstres-chimeres-1

 

Merci pour votre aide et que l'aventure commence ensemble ! Je suis impatient d'y arriver et de pouvoir vous proposer ces deux albums.

 

À quoi servira la collecte ?

 

Comme expliqué ci-dessus : La collecte servira à financer le gravage, l'édition et la publicité (en ce les frais Sabam y compris) de ce second volume des "Monstres & Chimères".

Les compositions sont déjà prêtes et prémasterisées. Ce CD sortira en 500 exemplaires. Si cela marche bien au niveau de la collecte, on pourra facilement en éditer 500 supplémentaires, et ainsi de suite. Mais commençons par 500...

 

Le projet n'attend plus que vous. Le contrat avec Musea Records est prêt à être signé. Il me reste à réunir les 2000 € dont j'ai besoin pour mener à bien ce projet. Voici le courrier de Musea Records :

 

Voici comment ces 2000 € seront répartis :

  • 1000 € : Impression de 500 CDs par Musea Records
  •   500 € : Frais Sabam pour droits d'auteur et reproduction mécanique
  •   500 € : Frais divers comme faux frais, frais de timbres, support pour le CD master,...

Merci par avance pour votre aide, votre soutien et votre mécénat.

Ce projet se concrétisera ensemble !

Laurent

story:
ME AND MY PROJECT

Hello everyone!

My name is Ivana Govedarska and I am from Bulgaria. I’m a professional classical pianist and I started playing the piano when I was 6. Since then my dream is to become an artist and I believe that with your support this can come true.

I was recently chosen to participate in a Master Music Training in Conservatori del Liceu, Barcelona where I will study with Prof. Stanislav Pochekin.

The donated money will help me pay the tuition fee for a full academic year Master Music Training Course in one of the best music academies in Europe.

 

WHAT IS THE MASTER MUSIC TRAINING?

Master music training studies are courses for musicians wishing to broaden their musical experience by participating in many concerts, lectures, master classes given by guest professors and other activities organized by the Conservatory. These things are really important for me and my further progress. Having this opportunity will deepen my instrumental and theoretical training and give me the chance to exchange and share various artistic experiences with musicians from different countries.

This is a link with more detailed information about the course:

http://www.conservatoriliceu.es/en/graduate/music-trainings-en

 

WHY IS IT IMPORTANT?

One of the most important steps of development for every musician is to have the chance to learn from the best musicians in the world in a competitional environment. Something that can provide them a real evaluation of the classical music world and motivate them each day to become better and better. Now, I have the chance to do it! Conservatori del Liceu hosts every year some of the finest musicians of our days. Every student can visit their courses and get inspired by them. This would give me the opportunity to meet most of the top artists nowadays which is a dream for every classical musician. Moreover, the Conservatory can offer their students a concert hall with brilliant acoustic and more than 100 “Steinway” and “Yamaha” grand pianos, which is extremely important for their further education. Studying there would give me the chance to pursue my dream - to prepare myself for high-level competitions, to participate in a lot of festivals, concerts and master classes.

 

WHY AM I SELECTED?

I was born in 1993 in Sofia, Bulgaria into a family of musicians. My grandfather was one of the most renowned choir conductors in our country. When I was 6 he raised my love of music and I started playing the piano. In 2012 I graduated the National School of Music, Sofia and then the National Music Academy in the piano class of the famous Bulgarian pianist Prof. Ivan Drenikov. Thankfully, I was so lucky to have him for my tutor because he has been not only a student of the great Italian pianist Arturo Benedetti Michelangeli, but also has been one of his closest friends whom the Maestro spent his time with. This fact will always have an impact on me as a musician. After getting my bachelor degree I was accepted in Conservatori del Liceu in Barcelona, Spain, where I graduated with excellence in the piano class of Prof. Stanislav Pochekin.

My first success came as early as 2007 when I won First Prize at the XII International Festival "Hopes, Talents, Masters", Dobrich, Bulgaria. In 2010 I won the First Prize at the XI International Young Pianists Competition, Nis, Serbia, and later that year I became the Third Prize winner at the International Competition "Prof. Josef Dichler", Vienna, Austria. I was also the winner of the First Prize and Special Prize of the National Academy of Music "Prof. P. Vladigerov" at the IX National Competition for Students-Accompanists, Pleven, Bulgaria – 2011. Another success came in 2015, where a high-level jury awarded me the Third Prize at the First International Piano Competition "Ciudad de Marbella", Spain, among participants from over 20 countries. In 2015, I took part in the “Festival de Piano and Master Classes de Saint Savin”, France, and in 2016 at the “MusikFest Piano Camp” Festival in Minnesota, USA, where I had the opportunity to work with distinguished musicians such as Prof. Alexander Braginsky, Prof. Miyoko Lotto and Prof. Alexander Sklioutovsky. In August this year I participated again in the “Festival de Piano and Master Classes de Saint Savin”, France as a scholarship student. In the competition held there, the result of which is determined by the vote of the professors, artistic directors and the audience, I was one of the 4 laureates from 18 participants from 7 countries.

More information about me you can find here: https://www.facebook.com/ivanagovedarskapiano/

 

HOW MUCH EXACTLY DOES IT COST?

Tuition fee: 3700€

Accommodation: 400€ per month

Living costs: 300€ per month

Travel costs: 60€ for a one way flight ticket with a low-cost company

 

The duration of the Master Music Training is 1 year. Until now I have saved the amount which can cover travel and accommodation costs but it’s still impossible for me to save the amount for the tuition fee. I will be very thankful for any help you can provide. Also once I get there I will be looking for a job which would be enough to pay for living and any other current costs.

 

WHAT WILL YOU GET IN RETURN
FOR YOUR GENEROSITY?

I will be grateful for everything you can help with. I tried to figure out interesting ways to reciprocate and if you have any other ideas, please feel free to contact me, so we can discuss them.

 

HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP?

You might not be able to help me financially but if you would like to support my project you can share it through your family, friends, co-workers or company using your facebook, twitter or just sending an email. I would greatly appreciate it!

 

THANK YOU for reading and listening and I hope you enjoyed my music!

Deep down in my heart I believe that fairytales are real! With your help I know I can live in mine.

The campaign is prepared in collaboration with the Trotoara Foundation. Video by CastFolio, cinematography by Haldigital97.

After getting my bachelor degree I was accepted in Conservatori del Liceu in Barcelona, Spain, where I graduated with excellence in the piano class of Prof. Stanislav Pochekin.My first success came as early as 2007 when I won First Prize at the XII International Festival "Hopes, Talents, Masters", Dobrich, Bulgaria. In 2010 I won the First Prize at the XI International Young Pianists Competition, Nis, Serbia, and later that year I became the Third Prize winner at the International Competition "Prof. Josef Dichler", Vienna, Austria. I was also the winner of the First Prize and Special Prize of the National Academy of Music "Prof. P. Vladigerov" at the IX National Competition for Students-Accompanists, Pleven, Bulgaria – 2011. Another success came in 2015, where a high-level jury awarded me the Third Prize at the First International Piano Competition "Ciudad de Marbella", Spain, among participants from over 20 countries. In 2015, I took part in the “Festival de Piano and Master Classes de Saint Savin”, France, and in 2016 at the “MusikFest Piano Camp” Festival in Minnesota, USA, where I had the opportunity to work with distinguished musicians such as Prof. Alexander Braginsky, Prof. Miyoko Lotto and Prof. Alexander Sklioutovsky. In August this year I participated again in the “Festival de Piano and Master Classes de Saint Savin”, France as a scholarship student. In the competition held there, the result of which is determined by the vote of the professors, artistic directors and the audience, I was one of the 4 laureates from 18 participants from 7 countries.More information about me you can find here: https://www.facebook.com/ivanagovedarskapiano/ HOW MUCH EXACTLY DOES IT COST?Tuition fee: 3700€Accommodation: 400€ per monthLiving costs: 300€ per monthTravel costs: 60€ for a one way flight ticket with a low-cost company The duration of the Master Music Training is 1 year. Until now I have saved the amount which can cover travel and accommodation costs but it’s still impossible for me to save the amount for the tuition fee. I will be very thankful for any help you can provide. Also once I get there I will be looking for a job which would be enough to pay for living and any other current costs. WHAT WILL YOU GET IN RETURNFOR YOUR GENEROSITY?I will be grateful for everything you can help with. I tried to figure out interesting ways to reciprocate and if you have any other ideas, please feel free to contact me, so we can discuss them. HOW ELSE YOU CAN HELP?You might not be able to help me financially but if you would like to support my project you can share it through your family, friends, co-workers or company using your facebook, twitter or just sending an email. I would greatly appreciate it! THANK YOU for reading and listening and I hope you enjoyed my music!Deep down in my heart I believe that fairytales are real! With your help I know I can live in mine.The campaign is prepared in collaboration with the Trotoara Foundation. Video by CastFolio, cinematography by Haldigital97.

story:
The Spring This Autumn

The Spring This Autumn formed in 2006 and recorded and released their self-titled full length debut in 2007 without any help from a record label. After a few years of playing shows in Sweden and writing new songs, the band disbanded in 2010.

Early 2017 however, they reformed and on September 1st, they released the EP 'What Remains' on Spotify, which contains the best songs off the full length album, to mark their return to the scene.

Now we're back.

After releasing our album we resumed writing new songs, and recorded a few demo songs in 2008 and started to record an EP in 2010. Now we're looking for funding to complete these recordings and to record a few more songs written in the years since we disbanded.

Failing drumtracking of new song in 2010.
 

Earlier this autumn, we digitally re-released the best songs off our self-titled debutalbum on the EP "Whats Remains". Now we're offering a deluxe version on Cassette (with download-code included) featuring the EP plus our Demo 2007 and 2008.

What Remains EP Deluxe Casette

  1. Vision
  2. Creation
  3. Capitulation
  4. Soak
  5. Blood
  6. Untitled Demo 1 [Demo 2008]
  7. Untitled Demo 2 [Demo 2008]
  8. Untitled Demo 3 [Demo 2008]
  9. Fire [Demo 2007]
  10. Water [Demo 2007]
  11. Earth [Demo 2007]
  12. Wind [Demo 2007]
  13. Blood [Demo 2007]

Listen to the EP (excluding Demo-tracks) on Spotify, Bandcamp, Soundcloud, Youtube

A True DIY Band

We're a small band with big ambitions. We've always done things DIY. Everything from printing t-shirts to recording music and playing shows, designing posters and putting it all together.

Our self-titled debut album was limited to 200 pcs, handmade, and was wrapped in handprinted linen cloth. We love doing things our own way.

Risks & Challenges

We understand that we're a small band. But we often get complimented for our music and the critical acclaim we received for our self-titled debut album is overwhelming. That's why we dare to say that we're "The Best Band You Never Heard".

All your contributions are appreciated, and we'll take what we get, and make the most out of it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Feel free to download our campaign videos and images and share on your social media networks and with your friends. It would mean the world to us if you shared our music with your peers.

story:
Hey,

meine Name ist Wu und ich bin Sänger und Rapper. Mein Team und Ich leben in Köln und es gibt eine musikalische Vision, die wir teilen. Wir machen Musik mit Aussagen - Musik, die durchdacht ist - Musik die berühren kann. Sie ist die Ausrucksform der reinen Inspiration und eine wichtige Form von Aktivismus und daher ein wichtiges kulturelles Gut. Nur fehlt es uns an Reichweite.

Aus diesem Grund möchten wir ein Musikvideo zu meinem Song ,,Time To Stay'' drehen. Unser Ziel ist es, mit diesem Video Zugang zu Kanälen zu bekommen, die uns Türen öffnen, um die Rapkultur mit unserer Musik zu bereichern.  

 

Ich brauche:

 in etwa 2.000€, um einen aufwändigen Dreh zu dem besagten Song, finanzieren zu können. Es ist heutzutage leider nur möglich, durch ein gut geplantes, aber vor Allem, ein gut umgesetztes Musikvideo, aufzufallen. Das angegebene Budget ist immernoch wenig, aber mit Hilfe eines sehr kompetenten Netzwerkes, wird es möglich sein, mit diesem Budget das Ziel zu erreichen, welches wir anstreben.

 

Wo und wie gedreht wird:

Der Plan ist es  zu zweit in der Schweiz zu drehen. Warum? Weil der Song textlich naturverbunden ist und er durch qualitativ hochwertige Landschaftsaufnahmen die Wirkung bekommen kann, die ihm gebührt. Vielleicht wird es aber aus kostengründen auch ein anderes Land, welches passende Naturspektakel zu bieten hat. Wichtig ist nur, dass wir das Performancevideo durch starke Naturaufnahmen so anfüttern können, dass es unseren Vorstellungen von Qualität entspricht, und somit das Potential hat, eben genannte Kanäle zu erreichen.

Wir möchten mit einer Drohne Luftaufnahmen machen, welche mit Farben und eindrucksvollen Bewegungen, wie Feuer, Wasser, Rauch, etc, spielen. Darüber hinaus stellen wir uns Nahaufnahmen von Requisiten vor , welche an den Text geknüpft, eingestreut werden. In Mitten dieses Settings werde ich den Song performen

 

Kosten:

  • Anreise, Mietwagen vor Ort, Unterkunft für zwei Nächte, Verpflegung für den Filmer und mich (500€)
  • Equipmentverleih und Versicherung (ca. 500€)
  • Bezahlung des Filmers für drei Drehtage + Postproduction (ca. 1.000 und das ist ein sehr großzügiger Freundschaftspreis)

 Das eingenommene Geld wird unmittelbar in das Projekt gesteckt.

 

Warum das Projekt wichtig ist:

Aktuell fällt die Rapkultur leider häufig durch Gewaltverherrlichung und Diskriminierung, wie  Sexismus, Homophobie, Transfeindlichkeit  etc. auf. Das Problem, welches wir darin sehen ist, dass Künstler*innen ihre Vorbildfuktion, und den damit einhergehenden Einfluss auf die zuhörende Jugend, unterschätzen. Dem wirken wir entgegen!

Ihr könnt uns dabei unterstützen, unseren Platz im sogannten ,,Rap Game" einzunehmen, um Das Genre mit Geschichten, die von Werten, wie Respekt, Toleranz, Widerstand gegen Rechts, Gesellschaftskritik, Kapitalismuskritik, Zukunftsvisionen, Liebe, Selbstbewusstsein und Zufriedenheit, handeln, weiter auszubauen. 

Das fertige Video soll durch diese Bilder, die passende Farbbearbeitung, dynamische Schnitte, Bewegung und den Song, repräsentieren, wie viel mehr aus Wort und Bild in Kombination zu holen ist, wenn man mit vollem Herzen an eine Sache glaubt und alles dafür tut, es sie umzusetzen. 

 

Was ich euch für die Unterstützung gebe:

Da wir nichts Materielles zu geben haben, bieten wir euch folgendes an:

  • Mein aktuelles Album ,,Directions*
  • Die EP, an der aktuell noch gearbeitet wird
  • Ein Wohnzimmerkonzert
  • Einen Videoblog während des Drehs, um zu sehen, wie wir arbeiten und im besten Fall sogar etwas über die praktische Arbeit mit Film zu lernen

 

Risiken & Herausforderungen:

Leider ist die erfolgreiche Umsetzung unseres Zieles eine Geldfrage. Sollten wir die angestrebten 2.000 Euro erreichen, ist es immernoch ein Betrag, der uns nicht grenzenlos Denken und Handeln lässt. Jedoch bleiben wir realistisch, und halten den finanziellen Aufwand (relativ!) klein, da wir wissen, dass wir auf ein sehr fähiges und ambitioniertes Umfeld zählen können. Die meiste Arbeit mit dem Projekt hat mein Filmer. Er dreht und schneidet das Video alleine. Wer sich bereits mit dieser Aufgabe auseinandergesetzt hat, weiß, dass die Arbeit an einem solchen Projekt sehr viel Zeit in Anspruch nimmt, um seinen eigenen Vorstellungen als Perfektionist, gerecht zu werden. Aus diesem Grund gebührt ihm der Löwenanteil des Geldes, was auf einen Stundenlohn gerechnet, immernoch nicht viel ist. Eben dies zeigt jedoch klar, dass es für uns alle eine Herzensangelegenheit ist.

Ein Risiko besteht für mich darin, dass durch diese Kampagne nicht genug Geld zusammen kommt, um ihn angemessen zu entlohnen. Das hätte zur Folge, dass ich die Kosten selber tragen muss, was ich nicht kann. Also steht und fällt dieses Projekt LEIDER mit dem Geld. Aus dieser Problematik entstand die Idee, die Kosten zu verkollektivieren, um es mit hilfe eines kleinen finanziellen Aufwandes der Masse, anstall des Einzelnen, realisieren zu können.

 

Ihr könnt mir anders helfen, wenn:
 

  • ihr Redakteur*innen in renomierten Hip-Hop Magazinen kennt, die sich für uns stark machen können
  • ihr Freunde in der Schweiz habt, bei denen wir zwei Nächte übernachten können
  • ihr Film-Equipment habt, welches ihr kostengünstig zum Verleih zur Verfügung stellen könnt
  • ihr uns helft, unsere Kampagne zu verbreiten
