story:
Hello!

My name is Vladimir! I am a classical guitarist and teacher.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need approximately 800 EUR fee for musicians.
  • One ticket price is 10 EUR, 3 EUR for pupils and students.

The LUTEDUO

Anna and Anton have come together to attract attention to the long neglected duo repertoire for the Baroque lute duo. United by a mutual fascination they wanted to help shed light upon music which was written during the final twilight hours of the lute’s bright history. They were the first to perform and record the recently discovered duet compositions of Francois du Fault and transcriptions of the Marin Marais’ duet viola da gamba compositions for two baroque lutes. This resulted in a program «Baroque Lute Duets” which was released on CD in 2002. Later they started to work on duo repertoire for other combinations of historical plucked instruments, especially baroque guitar and theorbo. Showcasing the contrasting styles of different cultures, the program “Baroque Insight” moves us from solemn music of great Italian lute and theorbo players (Allessandro Piccinini and Girolamo Kapsberger) to the temperamental style of the first Spanish guitar virtuosi (Gaspar Sanz and Santiago de Murcia) and melancholic mood of French baroque masters (R. de Visée and F. Couperin). Vast project dedicated to works of Johann Sebastian Bach covers solo works for lute including lute versions of solo violin and cello compositions as well as transcriptions of other instrumental works of the master for two 24 string Baroque lutes.

Recent activity of the duo concerns also 19th century music for romantic guitar. Using copies of 6 string guitars of the 19th century maker Rene Lete, strung with gut strings, the musicians perform works of J.K.Mertz, F. Sor, F. Chopin, Napoleon Coste. The high point of this program is the transcription of the famous organ work by Cesar Frank, Prelude Fugue & Variation, op.18

Anna and Anton successfully presented these programs across Europe performing in Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, The Netherlands, Lithuania, Poland, Romania, Russian Federation, Slovakia, Ukraine, and Switzerland.

story:
DIVERJE has been working on our NEW 12th album PURGE THE WORLD BEFORE for
the last 2 years and we have it all done, finalized, mastered and ready to
press! ALL DONE AND READY TO GO..WE JUST NEED SOME FUNDING TO MAKE IT HAPPEN!

  This album conceptually precedes our album from 2019 "THE NEXT WORLD",
as we take on the topics and reasons for the collapse of the "world before"
and why we became apocalyptic warriors and savage beasts fighting for survival.
Diverje has always been interested in these topics and feels like we have
predicted many of the events of the last 20 years as well as what is ahead.
 The album contains 13 brand new trax and 3 bonus trax on the CD!
Following a storyline similar to "THE NEXT WORLD"in the song titles and
conceptual imagery of the videos and songs,this is the world before THE NEXT
WORLD begins...
  With this new INDIEGOGO campaign we have also added on the OUT OF PRINT
and IN DEMAND CD'S of "AMPHIBIAN" and "AMPHIBIANS REMIX" for you to order
all new and re-mastered and re-issued as separate CD's and with new and
uniquely fun AMPHIBIAN artwork!
 Our CD campaign will go even further and add a 4TH CD! DIVERJE-
REMIX WARS VOL.3 continues the series of the DIVERJE remixes we
have done for our fellow allied musicians..enjoy a full CD of our best
remixes yet!!
 Also we have will new T-SHIRTS of the cover artwork of PURGE THE WORLD
BEFORE and a really cool DIVERJE POSTER!!

  We need our friends and Industrial music family to help us release
these 4 CD's by pre-ordering the albums now and till October 14th on
INDIEGOGO,and you can also order digital which will be transferred
over the BANDCAMP once the release happens on HALLOWEEN or soon after :-)


  WE NEED TO  REACH A TOTAL GOAL OF $3,000 as that will take care of
pressing 4 CD'S ( X 100-300 EACH), POSTERS (X 200), T-SHIRTS (X 20-40),
stickers(X 500)..it all costs a lot so we appreciate you all helping us get it done!
  THANK YOU TO ALL WHO CAN SUPPORT AND GET IN ON THIS PROJECT WHICH WILL
FEATURE YOUR NAME IN THE CREDITS AND EXTRAZ AS ALWAYS! MUCH LOVE AND
RESPECT, TOMMY T.RAPISARDI

story:
Hello everyone! I'm Dom Palombi, a freelance professional Drummer/Musician, Composer, Arranger, and Twitch Streamer based out of NJ. I'm very excited to share I've been working on my 2nd album to date entitled "Game Night", a Video Game Music focused collection of Covers and Originals featuring a Super Group of the best musicians in the Video Game Music Community! Before I get into why I decided to pursue this project, I'd to give you some context on how the past 3-4 years of my life have transpired.

 

Back in 2017, after graduating college with a music degree, I was pursuing multiple musical endeavors. Between working on musical projects, performances/gigs, and other freelance work, in my spare time I've been hanging out with a close friend group that were really into tabletop and video games. As the friend group continued to hang out more frequently, I learned at the time they traveled to a Gaming Convention up in Boston, Massachusetts called PAX EAST. Not knowing about said convention, I figured it would be a fun experience to get away from reality for a 4 day weekend, and see something new.

 

In the midst of attending said convention, I got the opportunity to experience (what would be) my entry and knowledge of Video Game Music as a primary focus. There were a multitude of musicians and bands performing music from video games at the convention, and it blew my mind. After this first experience, and having no expectation of it happening, I proceeded to venture to more gaming conventions/performances, connected with a VGM band called "The Super Soul Bros", and spent sometime hanging out with these guys in San Jose shortly after. We streamed on their twitch channel, which introduced me into the VGM community online, I felt even more inspired to learn more about VGM, and started streaming Drumming/Music on Twitch on August 13th, 2018.

 

As time progressed, not only did I meet more passionate musicians and others that loved this music, I also got the opportunity to perform with other groups at other conventions and see why this music in particular was so nostalgic and special. It was at that point I developed a new love for VGM, and decided that my next project would eventually be "Game Night."

 

One of the biggest challenges of this album has been doing everything completely remote. Due to the effect Covid-19 has caused on all of us, musicians alike haven’t had the chances to play live regularly and/or record/rehearse/perform as our lives used to be. 

Due to the causes of the pandemic, more people staying home equaled a large surplus of streamers online. After streaming on twitch for over 2 years, there was a lack of copyright-free resources available to streamers, content creators, and others. Copyright companies started to make thousands of DMCA claims to streamers online, making it harder to use everyday music in the background of their streams. Experiencing this 2nd hand, I purposely wanted to make sure this album would be a safe tool for streamers, YouTube creators, and anyone else that is looking for copyright-free music.

 

At that period of time of adaptation, I wanted to take advantage of the time while everyone was home, and make the most out of the freedom that we’d have during this past year of quarantine to make something truly special.

Now to make a project like this possible takes a lot of time, planning, producing, recording, mixing/mastering, and much more. It's also not cheap to produce a project like this, especially involving 16 Musicians (including myself), hiring an artist for all of the album artwork/logos/branding, hiring a video editor to produce professional quality music videos to go out to social media, and everything else you don't see happening behind the scenes. Game nights are all about community, and without this amazing community of musicians, gamers and folks like you, a project like this would not be possible.Here's a price breakdown of all of the expenses necessary to bring this to fruition:

  • Music Commissions, Mixing and Mastering: $2,500
  • Album/Merch Artwork and Branding: $1,000
  • CD Production: $1,000
  • YouTube Music Videos: $900
  • Digital Distribution/Cover Song Licensing (via Soundrop): $100

 

These costs are just an idea of what most of it looks like, it doesn't include all of the time spent making all of this possible, and the perks/merchandise that will be made for you all helping out making this project a reality! That being said, making a lot of this merch and shipping costs will be pretty expensive, so I won't be ordering more merchandise past this campaign, BUT the more that is raised, the more of it can be available to you all!

Here's some promos of the merchandise from some the perks you could get!

Stickers:

Trading Cards:

 

Additionally, I'm very excited to share with you all the full track list of "GAME NIGHT":

  1. Now Loading (Original) - Feat. Tony Dickinson
  2. Air Man (Mega Man 2) - Feat. Carlos Eiene
  3. Lagging (Original) - Feat. Jasper Dutz and Ryan Slatko
  4. Green Hill Zone (Sonic the Hedgehog) Feat. Max Boiko and Jake Silverman aka. Button Masher
  5. Corridors of Time (Chrono Trigger) - Feat. Patrick Bartley
  6. Waluigi Pinball (Mario Kart 8) - Feat. Adam Neely and Charlie Rosen
  7. Win or Lose, We’re Still Friends (Original) - Feat. Dave Pollack
  8. Halo 3 Theme (Halo 3) - Feat. Super Soul Bros

 

After this campaign is all said and done, we will be celebrating this album's entirety by doing a big listening party on my Twitch Broadcast, and I'll be having members of the album joining me live on a zoom call to celebrate the big occasion! (Date TBD).

I hope you all are as excited as I am about this album, as I've poured my heart and soul into this, and I truly believe it’s one of my best works to date. I’m very fortunate to have some of my favorite musicians in the VGM scene on this album, who also are some of my best friends as of late, and can’t express how excited I am for you all to hear this finished product! 

 

Be sure to keep up with me here on this Indiegogo campaign, and follow all of my social media so you can get direct updates about what’s still to come! If you can't contribute, don't feel bad, share this campaign with as many people as possible, whether they know a thing or two about Video Game Music or not. If you just love music, this is another great opportunity to experience just that, and the more people we can get involved, the closer this album will come to reality! Thanks for taking some time out of your day to check out this new album, and I hope to see you all soon, at our next Game Night!

 

Much Love,

- Dom Palombi

www.dompalombimusic.com | @dompalombimusic on ALL social media
story_txt:
Hello everyone! I'm Dom Palombi, a freelance professional Drummer/Musician, Composer, Arranger, and Twitch Streamer based out of NJ. I'm very excited to share I've been working on my 2nd album to date entitled "Game Night", a Video Game Music focused collection of Covers and Originals featuring a Super Group of the best musicians in the Video Game Music Community! Before I get into why I decided to pursue this project, I'd to give you some context on how the past 3-4 years of my life have transpired. Back in 2017, after graduating college with a music degree, I was pursuing multiple musical endeavors. Between working on musical projects, performances/gigs, and other freelance work, in my spare time I've been hanging out with a close friend group that were really into tabletop and video games. As the friend group continued to hang out more frequently, I learned at the time they traveled to a Gaming Convention up in Boston, Massachusetts called PAX EAST. Not knowing about said convention, I figured it would be a fun experience to get away from reality for a 4 day weekend, and see something new. In the midst of attending said convention, I got the opportunity to experience (what would be) my entry and knowledge of Video Game Music as a primary focus. There were a multitude of musicians and bands performing music from video games at the convention, and it blew my mind. After this first experience, and having no expectation of it happening, I proceeded to venture to more gaming conventions/performances, connected with a VGM band called "The Super Soul Bros", and spent sometime hanging out with these guys in San Jose shortly after. We streamed on their twitch channel, which introduced me into the VGM community online, I felt even more inspired to learn more about VGM, and started streaming Drumming/Music on Twitch on August 13th, 2018. As time progressed, not only did I meet more passionate musicians and others that loved this music, I also got the opportunity to perform with other groups at other conventions and see why this music in particular was so nostalgic and special. It was at that point I developed a new love for VGM, and decided that my next project would eventually be "Game Night." One of the biggest challenges of this album has been doing everything completely remote. Due to the effect Covid-19 has caused on all of us, musicians alike haven’t had the chances to play live regularly and/or record/rehearse/perform as our lives used to be. Due to the causes of the pandemic, more people staying home equaled a large surplus of streamers online. After streaming on twitch for over 2 years, there was a lack of copyright-free resources available to streamers, content creators, and others. Copyright companies started to make thousands of DMCA claims to streamers online, making it harder to use everyday music in the background of their streams. Experiencing this 2nd hand, I purposely wanted to make sure this album would be a safe tool for streamers, YouTube creators, and anyone else that is looking for copyright-free music. At that period of time of adaptation, I wanted to take advantage of the time while everyone was home, and make the most out of the freedom that we’d have during this past year of quarantine to make something truly special.Now to make a project like this possible takes a lot of time, planning, producing, recording, mixing/mastering, and much more. It's also not cheap to produce a project like this, especially involving 16 Musicians (including myself), hiring an artist for all of the album artwork/logos/branding, hiring a video editor to produce professional quality music videos to go out to social media, and everything else you don't see happening behind the scenes. Game nights are all about community, and without this amazing community of musicians, gamers and folks like you, a project like this would not be possible.Here's a price breakdown of all of the expenses necessary to bring this to fruition:
Music Commissions, Mixing and Mastering: $2,500

Album/Merch Artwork and Branding: $1,000

CD Production: $1,000

YouTube Music Videos: $900

Digital Distribution/Cover Song Licensing (via Soundrop): $100

 These costs are just an idea of what most of it looks like, it doesn't include all of the time spent making all of this possible, and the perks/merchandise that will be made for you all helping out making this project a reality! That being said, making a lot of this merch and shipping costs will be pretty expensive, so I won't be ordering more merchandise past this campaign, BUT the more that is raised, the more of it can be available to you all!Here's some promos of the merchandise from some the perks you could get!Stickers:Trading Cards: Additionally, I'm very excited to share with you all the full track list of "GAME NIGHT":

Now Loading (Original) - Feat. Tony Dickinson

Air Man (Mega Man 2) - Feat. Carlos Eiene

Lagging (Original) - Feat. Jasper Dutz and Ryan Slatko

Green Hill Zone (Sonic the Hedgehog) Feat. Max Boiko and Jake Silverman aka. Button Masher

Corridors of Time (Chrono Trigger) - Feat. Patrick Bartley

Waluigi Pinball (Mario Kart 8) - Feat. Adam Neely and Charlie Rosen

Win or Lose, We’re Still Friends (Original) - Feat. Dave Pollack

Halo 3 Theme (Halo 3) - Feat. Super Soul Bros
 After this campaign is all said and done, we will be celebrating this album's entirety by doing a big listening party on my Twitch Broadcast, and I'll be having members of the album joining me live on a zoom call to celebrate the big occasion! (Date TBD).I hope you all are as excited as I am about this album, as I've poured my heart and soul into this, and I truly believe it’s one of my best works to date. I’m very fortunate to have some of my favorite musicians in the VGM scene on this album, who also are some of my best friends as of late, and can’t express how excited I am for you all to hear this finished product!  Be sure to keep up with me here on this Indiegogo campaign, and follow all of my social media so you can get direct updates about what’s still to come! If you can't contribute, don't feel bad, share this campaign with as many people as possible, whether they know a thing or two about Video Game Music or not. If you just love music, this is another great opportunity to experience just that, and the more people we can get involved, the closer this album will come to reality! Thanks for taking some time out of your day to check out this new album, and I hope to see you all soon, at our next Game Night! Much Love,- Dom Palombiwww.dompalombimusic.com | @dompalombimusic on ALL social media

story:
Hello, friends!

 

It is a joy to be on this journey and have the opportunity to record and release some of the dozens of songs that I’ve written over the years. Thank you SO very much for being involved in this process. 

 

In anticipation of curiosity, I’ve responded to several possible questions below:

 

What is the impact of me contributing to this campaign?

I’m hoping this is a jumping off point for writing and releasing more music. It makes all the difference in the world to have a polished, studio crafted album to give to people. My prayer is that this music will encourage people and that the Lord is glorified through it. 

 

Why $5000?

The proceeds of the campaign help to cover the cost of:

  • production: recording, mixing, mastering
  • personnel: producer, additional musicians
  • design: album cover and layout, promotional images, photography
  • distribution: creation of physical copies, digital platform fees

Note: The funds collected will be funneled down in that order, and any exceeding funds will go to aid with travel to the studio and graphic design beyond the album.

 

Who is recording/producing the album? 

Nathan Holliday |  Website

 

Will this be a worship album? 

These songs were not written to be sung corporately by the church, but are certainly spiritual in nature. I create out of what I know, believe, trust, love, and feel, which often has a strong bend toward my being a follower of Jesus. 

 

How can I connect/follow LHWJ on social media?

  •   Instagram: @leavingherwaterjar
  •   Twitter:  @_lhwj

 

Where can I get more information or get additional questions answered? 

You can email Megan directly with any questions at leavingherwaterjar@gmail.com

 

When can I expect my perks?

Recording dates are set starting in April. I will get the perks to you as fast as I can, but production takes time. Here is the goal: at the earliest — October 2019; at the latest — March 2020. 

 

What are ways I can help beyond financially?

  • Share! Talk about the campaign to others. Share a link on your social media. Tell your friends and family. Text or email a few people who might be interested.
  • Pray! Ask God for bountiful provision in every way, wisdom for Megan and the team throughout the process, the glory of God to be exalted with every step, etc.
  • Use the hashtag: #lhwjdebutalbum on social media to spread the word
  • Take advantage of the Indiegogo share tools at the top of the campaign page

 

I am extremely grateful for your interest and support of my art. Again, thank you.

And may the peace of Christ be with you….

 

- Megan

story:
Short Summary

Barley has been working hard in Southern California for the last 10 years with well over 1000 live shows and 3 albums.  When the creative juices flow it's time to put pen to paper and record our hopes and dreams for distribution to our fans and friends.  We have the opportunity to record at the amazing Brotheryn Studios and master at Capital Records.  While it's not an inexpensive endeavor, this will be our first time in a studio of this caliber, recording the entire album in one weekend from start to finish.  We want to make this the best Barley album we've ever done and the songs we've written support that.  As many shows as we've played we don't charge a cover, so we are looking to you now for a contribution, big or small, to keep the music alive.  We are asking you to consider helping us fund this next chapter in the Barley life.

What We Need & What You Get

This album will cost $10,000, nearly half of what a boot strapping studio album normally costs.  We feel we have streamlined the process in our experiences by working through all of the parts in the studio at one time versus piecing things together over time.  We plan to get in, work hard, and walk out with a finished recorded product.  From there we can add any finishing touches, mix it, master it, and show it to the world.

We have some great perks of course which include the album, apparel, private shows, a VIP listening experience, and exclusive membership into the Project Barley Mug Club.

The Impact

We routinely see the joy our band brings to people at our shows.  This is what continues to make our family (a.k.a. band) work so hard to set up shows, write new music, and create an atmosphere that is fun and enjoyable for all ages.  We are inspired and flattered by the support that we have gained as we continue down our path as a family.  We are very proud of our new songs and you will hear a lot of references to things you may know very well:

"On a South Bay, saltwater day, life is beautiful again"

"We are alive, on The Strand cruising, waves of Sunshine"

"We will sing a song to everyone that still plays the music loud, dance and shout"

"Good friends are what we are, seasoned and battle scarred"

"These Batman Underoos, check out my Super Hero moves"

"Those Regerbombs are made for jail"

"Sunshine on the weekends, cold beer and good friends"

Just a few lines that have taken inspiration from our friends, family, experiences, and locale. 

Risks & Challenges

We know this is a huge ask from you and it doesn't come without it's challenges.  There is no risk in getting this project done, but the process is pretty intense and we will need to bring our "A" game.  We have been rehearsing in our practice space for 6+ months and have been sprinkling in some of the songs at live shows.  We know that we need to get in the studio and nail it in one or two takes in order to get through the process as intended.  We knew going in to this album that we needed to work incredibly hard to streamline this process to cut production time and money down.  In addition to our jobs, families, activities, and many, many shows, we have done just that.  We can't wait to show you our hard work!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone is in a financial position to contribute to this campaign, but you can support in other ways.  Please help us get the word out and share via email, text, social media, and anything other new thing the kids may be using :)

story:
Hi friends! We're in the studio putting together our first full-length album. We're raising money to help with recording, mixing, mastering, and distribution expenses. We want to make the best sounding album we can give you!!


Music brings people together in a world where so much is divided. Nothing makes us happier than writing and playing music together. It's our dream come true to make an album that sounds as beautiful as this one will. A full-length album is an incredibly unique and powerful art form that can take the listener on a journey through life's emotions. These songs are the result of passion, love, and integrity and we want to give them the recording quality they deserve. We've all spent our lives idolizing bands and wanting to follow in their footsteps. We are so grateful for your support! It means the world to us



We're a psychedelic progressive pop-rock band based in Bellingham, WA, made up of four dedicated and passionate members: vocalist, keyboardist, and guitarist Carly Gilliland, vocalist and guitarist Connor Kelly, drummer Bobby Pelkey, and bassist Joseph Vacca. Like a fresh kiwi, our music is vibrant, sweet, and satisfying. We blend groove-centric jams with sensual vocals, funky bass lines, tasteful drumming, and an exploration of atmospheric guitar tones. Our influences are vast: Pond, The Beatles, Explosions in the Sky, Pink Floyd, Radiohead, Tame Impala, Led Zeppelin, The Strokes, Talking Heads, David Bowie, and Tears For Fears. We jammed for the first time in late 2018, and a few months later Smooth Kiwi was born. 

Give our first demo a listen as you continue reading!





 


Don't have time to read EVERYTHING below?
That's cool - here's the gist of it:

We're from Bellingham, WA and have been a band for a little over a year. We're in the middle of recording and have brilliant producers/engineers, Samuel Wesner and Will Clawson working with us. 

In order for us to have enough resources to really make this album the best it can be there are 3 things We'd love for you to do:

    1. Pick your perk

    2. Contribute

    3. Help spread the word!!

We would be forever grateful if you can help turn this album into a reality! Be apart of the journey!

 

      


Photo by Alaina Bash




  
 

We're recording at Alpenglow Studios  and Bell Creek Studios! After we're done recording we will mix our songs in part at The Unknown Studios on one of the most legendary tape machines ever, the Studer 24 track reel-to-reel to give it that warm, rich, vintage, saucy sound! Our goal is to release the album by the end of 2020 (keeping our fingers crossed!).

Photo by Alaina Bash


 

We'd really appreciate your help tackling some of these up front album costs (broken down below), so we’re offering a preorder of our album and some other exciting treats to help make it happen!

Perks include:

  • Pre-order of Album (digital, CD, or cassette)
  • Release show ticket
  • Signed posters
  • ​CD credits
  • ​Stickers
  • & much more!


​And if you want to go really big, we're offering a Private House Show Perk AND a Custom Song Perk! 

See a more detailed list of our perks to the right (computer) or above (mobile).
"+" = That perk w/ more perks included


Photo by Kelsea Hill




As you can see by this bright little pie chart, recording an album can be expensive. We've broken the costs down so you know what's being spent where. At the end of the day, we want to make a great sounding album for you.

The "Recording, Mixing, Mastering" section also includes the cost of hiring engineers, studio time at three different locations, and travel.






 
 

If it isn’t financially possible to contribute to our campaign - it's groovy, we understand! There are other things you can do that make a huge difference, and they don't cost a thing. 

You can:

  • Share our campaign on social media
  • Have a yarn with your boss, friends, foes, bartenders, neighbors
  • Listen to our music
  • Tag us in your Instagram stories

You never know who might want to help. And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools, it makes things a bit easier to spread the word!

Here's our 2nd demo 'Fast Mystery' , a short instrumental for the remainder of your stay!
 


 


 

Photo by Alaina Bash

Here's our 2nd demo 'Fast Mystery' , a short instrumental for the remainder of your stay! 

 
 Photo by Alaina Bash

story:
Overview

Hello friends! I’m Ché Aimee Dorval, a singer and songwriter from Vancouver, Canada. I’ve been releasing albums for 10 + years and collaborating with some pretty special people, Devin Townsend, Morgan Agren, Gord Downie and Bob Rock to drop a few names ;) Collaborating and creating with these people has inspired me to take chances and opened my eyes to the real potential of my music. Now, I’ve decided is the time, so I’m embarking on my most ambitious project to date!

About 'The Crowned' 

A few years ago I started writing and recording with Bob Rock after a mutual friend introduced us at the Warehouse studios in Vancouver. Just for fun, we started demo swapping and idea sharing, bonding over a deep rooted passion for meaningful songwriting and production. We had no clear goal in sight, it was just fun. In my life, that’s how all of my meaningful musical partnerships have started. It was through working with Bob I truly came into my own. I grew as a songwriter and a producer and I stopped holding back and after a couple months, it was obvious that these songs were special and needed to be heard. It was then that we started to make plans for my next album, The Crowned.  

We were at the halfway mark when Covid-19 struck and we put everything on hold. With Bob living in Hawaii and myself held up in Vancouver all we could do was wait, but now, with the world opening up again, we’re set to finish the record and get it out there! 

What You'll Get

As a self funded indie artist I rely on platforms like this to help fund the creation and the promotion of all my releases. So, I’ve come up with a plan and its my hope you will join me in making it happen! 

Over the past few months, I’ve been creating a bunch of amazing content to help fund the finishing up of this record. With this indiegogo campaign I’ll be selling tickets to the following, paired up with other goodies to make it all worth your while. The goodies are:

A Woodland Performance: A month ago I ventured into the deep forests of British Columbia with Aaron Nathanson and Samuel Chadwick to film an intimate and serene performance of 4 of the new tracks from “The Crowned”.  

An Advanced Screening of the 'Blood Red Son' Music Video: I just finished filming a music video for the first single from The Crowned entitled “Blood Red Son”, and in no word of a lie, it is the most intense and beautiful visual project I’ve never been a part of. It marries my love of old horror films and David Lynch style filmmaking and I cannot wait until it’s out it the world. I’ll be offering ticket holders a sneak peak stream of that before it's release into the world! 

'The Crowned' Streamed Performance: Watch a streamed performance featuring new material from The Crowned as well as tracks from my previous records. Played with a full band and featuring studio quality production and lighting design, this will be the first time many of these tracks have even been heard. 

On top of all that, there’s also a bunch of other goodies like: handwritten lyric sheets, new t-shirt merchandise designs, posters and everything you’d expect of a crowdfunding campaign. 

What I Need

In the spirit of full transparency, here’s the break down of the costs associated with the making and breaking this record:

New Album ‘The Crowned” - $10,000

To finish the record we need to raise 10,000 for studio time, musicians, mixing and mastering. Bob and I have already finished 5 tracks but had to put our project on hold due to Covid 19. There are still 8 more tracks currently in the demo stage, to go that are eagerly awaiting the attention the first 5 tracks received.

Promotion of ‘The Crowned’ - $12,000

Long gone are the days where I quietly put out an album. I’m so proud of what I am achieving with this record. It needs to be heard. I want to perform it in every city around the world. We have 2 publicists on standby. One in North America and one in Europe/UK, and they will be servicing the album, along with all of the accompanying music videos, to all levels of traditional + online/digital media.  They will work hard at setting up single/video premieres, advance album streams, album reviews, press, interviews, etc. in order to help expose this album to a broader audience. 

Music video for the second single - $10,000

As I learned last week through shooting the music video for the first single “Blood Red Son”, if you want to do it right, if you want to make something stunning, you’re going to end up spending a lot more than you initially thought you would but in the end it’s worth it. Cinematographer Aaron Nathanson and I just finished shooting a twin peaks-esq horror movie style music video that I am so incredibly excited to share with you. It was an immense amount of work. Throughout the process I wore many many hats and learned so much. Costume designer, Set decorator, Writer, Actor, Producer, Crew, holy fuck I did it all, and I did it with a team of amazing, talented, lovely people who believed in the project. It really does take a village.  

Streamed Full Band Performance - $4000

As I’ve said, I want to tour as much as possible as soon as possible. Prior to Covid 19, I was well on my way to doing just that. It started with Devin Townsend’s 2019/2020 European and North American Empath tours where I sang and played guitar. What an incredible experience that was. It really lit a fire under my ass. Through it, I started to receive offers of other tours for my solo work which was amazing. It was everything I’d ever wanted. Then, the world as we knew it ended and so did all of those tours. This livestream aims to both promote the new album and entertain you lovely folks but also show booking agents what I have to offer. Where I fit sonically in the musical world. 

I want you guys to feel like you’re getting as much bang for your buck but more importantly, I want you all to feel like you’re a part of this album, and it’s success. It’s been a long road and all of you have been on it with me every step of the way, I literally could not have got this far without you, your support of my quarantine EP allowed me to survive as an artist throughout the pandemic, I believe we can do this too!

The Impact

These tracks show a side of me you’ve never seen before, too cautious to share in the past. This album represents strength, power and vulnerability. It also represents drive and focus. I am driven to be heard, to be seen and to perform more so than I ever have. The pandemic showed me what a life without live music would be like and I gotta tell you, I’m not a fan. With this album I aim to tour globally, create beautiful and affecting visuals to accompany these songs and to reach the ears of those who have yet to discover me.

So thats the plan! As you can see, the above numbers add up to an exorbitant amount of cash, maybe we won’t get all the way, although, wouldn’t it be rad if we did? Its a stretch but who knows, I believe in us! :)

Finally, thank you, for everything. For reading this far, for your continued support though all of my projects to date and for your belief in me. I’m here because of you. You keep me full of hope and inspiration and I’d like to return the favour by creating beautiful music and exceeding your wildest expectations whatever they may be :)

Thank you!

*Indiegogo doesn't accept paypal but i do! Go to:  https://www.cheaimeedorval.com/indiegogo-paypal-store
story_txt: OverviewHello friends! I’m Ché Aimee Dorval, a singer and songwriter from Vancouver, Canada. I’ve been releasing albums for 10 + years and collaborating with some pretty special people, Devin Townsend, Morgan Agren, Gord Downie and Bob Rock to drop a few names ;) Collaborating and creating with these people has inspired me to take chances and opened my eyes to the real potential of my music. Now, I’ve decided is the time, so I’m embarking on my most ambitious project to date!About 'The Crowned' A few years ago I started writing and recording with Bob Rock after a mutual friend introduced us at the Warehouse studios in Vancouver. Just for fun, we started demo swapping and idea sharing, bonding over a deep rooted passion for meaningful songwriting and production. We had no clear goal in sight, it was just fun. In my life, that’s how all of my meaningful musical partnerships have started. It was through working with Bob I truly came into my own. I grew as a songwriter and a producer and I stopped holding back and after a couple months, it was obvious that these songs were special and needed to be heard. It was then that we started to make plans for my next album, The Crowned.  We were at the halfway mark when Covid-19 struck and we put everything on hold. With Bob living in Hawaii and myself held up in Vancouver all we could do was wait, but now, with the world opening up again, we’re set to finish the record and get it out there! What You'll GetAs a self funded indie artist I rely on platforms like this to help fund the creation and the promotion of all my releases. So, I’ve come up with a plan and its my hope you will join me in making it happen! Over the past few months, I’ve been creating a bunch of amazing content to help fund the finishing up of this record. With this indiegogo campaign I’ll be selling tickets to the following, paired up with other goodies to make it all worth your while. The goodies are:A Woodland Performance: A month ago I ventured into the deep forests of British Columbia with Aaron Nathanson and Samuel Chadwick to film an intimate and serene performance of 4 of the new tracks from “The Crowned”.  An Advanced Screening of the 'Blood Red Son' Music Video: I just finished filming a music video for the first single from The Crowned entitled “Blood Red Son”, and in no word of a lie, it is the most intense and beautiful visual project I’ve never been a part of. It marries my love of old horror films and David Lynch style filmmaking and I cannot wait until it’s out it the world. I’ll be offering ticket holders a sneak peak stream of that before it's release into the world! 'The Crowned' Streamed Performance: Watch a streamed performance featuring new material from The Crowned as well as tracks from my previous records. Played with a full band and featuring studio quality production and lighting design, this will be the first time many of these tracks have even been heard. On top of all that, there’s also a bunch of other goodies like: handwritten lyric sheets, new t-shirt merchandise designs, posters and everything you’d expect of a crowdfunding campaign. What I NeedIn the spirit of full transparency, here’s the break down of the costs associated with the making and breaking this record:New Album ‘The Crowned” - $10,000To finish the record we need to raise 10,000 for studio time, musicians, mixing and mastering. Bob and I have already finished 5 tracks but had to put our project on hold due to Covid 19. There are still 8 more tracks currently in the demo stage, to go that are eagerly awaiting the attention the first 5 tracks received.Promotion of ‘The Crowned’ - $12,000Long gone are the days where I quietly put out an album. I’m here because of you. You keep me full of hope and inspiration and I’d like to return the favour by creating beautiful music and exceeding your wildest expectations whatever they may be :)Thank you!*Indiegogo doesn't accept paypal but i do! story:
My name is Layla Zoe, I am an award winning blues rock singer from Canada living in Europe, and have been singing professionally and releasing albums for over a decade. I have travelled the world with my music and my passion to sing started as a young girl, raised on my father's love of the blues and educated by his record collection. I have been blessed to see many new places, sing with many incredible people and meet so many wonderful fans over the years. Now, I ask for your help in making a dream come true. After 9 years with record labels I had to step back this year and take a break. Although I was grateful for everything my past labels had done for me, I could see my love of music changing. My desire to create was being affected by this machine we call the "music business" and even my health was being affected by the stress I had endured working with labels while still trying to remain true to myself and my creative spirit. I knew I wanted to go back to a simpler, more pure method of creating and writing and recording. My first 5 albums were made independently before I signed to my first label, and I knew that I was ready again to release my next album independently, only this time bringing with me all the tools and talents I had learned over the years.


Photo of Layla with her father.

My concept was to make an album I had dreamed of making for years, the "Gemini" album, a double album of electric and acoustic songs reflecting my own 2 sides musically, spiritually and astrologically. I had discussed this concept with one of my previous labels but the timing wasn't right, but now I knew it was the perfect time to start this concept album as I stepped out on my own to create something independently. I started writing for this album with my guitarist Jan Laacks (who is also a gemini!) in 2017, and together we wrote over 30 songs together. We have chosen our favourite 20 tracks for this very special project which features tones of blues, rock, and folk to showcase the genres I love so deeply and to demonstrate the power and fragility of my voice. And after months of pre-production on the new songs, it is now finally time to start the crowdfunding campaign to raise the money we need to finish this album so we can share it with all of you! With your help we will have the funds to pay for the studio production, recording, mixing and mastering of the album, the CD graphics and design, and manufacturing of the album!
 


Photo c/o Jacques Clérin.

After researching many other artist campaigns I saw that many also asked for extra money to help with promotion. But I have decided after much consideration that I will choose only to ask for the most basic costs that I need right now to finish recording and to release the album. I will spend the time later once the album is manufactured to mail out hundreds of copies to radio and journalists myself once the album is pressed and let this album speak for itself. I want to release it in the most true "grass roots" way and tour the album in as many countries as possible to promote the songs live on stage. But I also believe in the power of "word of mouth" and have seen how the spirit of one fan who loves an album can help to spread the word to a "village" of other music lovers. I believe in my fans, I believe in this album, I believe in what my guitarist and I have created together on this project and I am so excited to take this next step together with all of you, to make this album a reality.  I will run this crowdfunding campaign for 30 days, and every penny received will help us to get closer to the goal of releasing the "Gemini" double album this fall. Your help, your belief, your passion and your financial support is the only way I can make this record and it means everything to me that I have had you all by my side for so many years through the ups, the downs, and every moment in between. Please help me in these final steps to create and release "GEMINI". Your support means everything right now as I forge these new waters. 


Photo c/o Jacques Clérin, poster graphics c/o Timo Wilke.

There are many different "perks" packages to try and accommodate all sizes, styles and types of donations to the project. We hope you find one you like, or if you prefer to support the album without choosing a "perk" package, we are so grateful for your contribution and no amount is too small or will go unnoticed or unappreciated. I look forward to updating you all with news, song clips, videos once we go into the studio and more sneak peeks along the way. And by sharing this campaign with your friends, family, colleagues and other music lovers, you will help us have a better chance of raising what we need to record, finish and release the album this year. So please don't hesitate to share and help us spread the word. TOGETHER, we can make this album a reality. Please help me to make this "Gemini" dream come true...

 All my love, appreciation, gratitude, talent and sincere thanks for your support,

Xx Layla Zoe (aka "the Firegirl")

PS...If you cannot make a payment through this website for any reason, or prefer to pay by PAYPAL, e-transfer or direct bank transfer, please just contact us and we can make other payment arrangements for you!


Photo c/o Layla's mother.



Layla Zoe on stage with friend, producer and guitarist Jan Laacks.
 


Layla Zoe on stage with friend Sonny Landreth, and Ana Popovic at Blues Peer festival, Belgium.

 


Layla Zoe on stage as a guest of friend Sonny Landreth at Rockpalast, Bonn, Germany.

 


Layla Zoe with friend Jeff Healey, in Toronto, 2007.

 


Layla Zoe on stage with Jeff Healey at his club in Toronto, 2007.

 


Layla Zoe on stage with Jeff Healey and band, January, 2008.

 


Layla Zoe and Joe Bonamassa backstage, Grolsch Blues Festival, Germany, 2009.

 


Layla Zoe with Buddy Guy at his club in Chicago, Illinois, 2007.

 


Layla Zoe with Susan Tedeschi and Derek Trucks backstage in Montreal, Quebec, 2013.

 


Layla Zoe in Mumbai, India, doing press for the Mahindra Blues Festival with John Mayall, Coco Montoya and Walter "Wolfman" Washington, 2018.

 


Coming up in 2018, the Gemini Tour in Europe. More information at www.layla.ca

story:
Dans l'Oeil de la Tempête - 30th Anniversary Limited Edition

Please read important information at the bottom! *

Handful of Snowdrops' sophomore album was released in 1991. The album reception was mixed. Loved by some and hated by others, it was a major departure from their debut, Land of the Damned.

It had qualities, but it also had problems. We didn't have the means to match our ambitions. We were green and clueless and most importantly, we couldn't afford to work with the great engineers and producers our contemporaries from Europe could.  "C'est la Mort", our American label at the time, didn't care to master or even normalise the album, which already suffered from weak bass content, before releasing it.

Dans l'Oeil de la Tempête was release without promotion and so went completely unnoticed in the US, Canada and the rest of the world, except in our home province of Quebec were the album received a rather surprising amount of attention although, ironically, it was only available as an import!  

For its 30th anniversary I thought it would be a good idea to give it a little love. So here's the idea if you're up for it: 

  • A double CD jewel box, in a cardboard slipcase, limited to 100 copies.
  • The first CD would hold the 8 tracks featured on the original,
    remastered (or mastered in this case!)
  • The second CD would contain an alternative mix of "Hush",  2 tracks recorded for two different 'C'est la Mort - Doctor Death' compilations, "Now, Then and Forever" and "Second by Second",  plus 6 demos recorded prior to the album, "Sometimes I", "In the Eye of the Storm", "Now, Then and Forever",  and some of which that didn't make the final cut like, "Sleep Away", "Charlatan" and "Over My Head".

 

I made it simple. For the goal to be reached, all 100 copies have to be sold. Since the campaign has a fixed goal, it is risk free. So, if that goal isn't met, everyone will be refunded in full. If the goal is met, I will start working on it for good and expect to have it shipped in the first week of octobre, but hopefully sooner. If you have other questions please take a look at the FAQ section and if you don't find an answer there, you can contact me via the "ASK A QUESTION" link near the top of the page. So, has 30 years been long enough?

*Important, please read

YOU CAN ONLY GET ONE COPY EACH, so everyone has a chance to secure one. That will also help to prevent the usual abuser buying multiple copies to resale them at ridiculous prices on music marketplaces. If at one point it looks like the goal won't be met, I'll maybe allow people to buy more. The campaign is on for 30 days, so fingers crossed…

THANK YOU!

story:
***Updated Goal***

Thanks to you we met our initial goal for the new album in less than 48 hours! We’ve decided if we can raise a little extra we’ll be able to re-record some old songs and release them this fall, before the new record comes out. Any extra funds will go towards music videos and the merchandise line. We’ve also added a few new perks so be sure to check those out.

$10,000 - Recording, Mixing & Producing

$4,200 - Mastering 

$5,800 - Distribution of CDs & Vinyl

Short Summary

Hey there! We're Nick and Tyler Talbott, two brothers who grew up writing songs together, running each other over with dirt bikes and leaving our hometown in Nebraska to start a music career in the Pacific Northwest. We've spent the past 6 years touring the world, meeting new friends and making records. Now it's time to make another one and we're inviting you to be a part of it. This past year has looked a lot different for everyone, not just musicians. We've been reminded that building a strong community and being a part of one another's journey is essential, no matter what you're doing. To make a positive difference, we simply cannot do this alone. In order to be more effective and bridge the gap from 2020 to 2021, we've decided to invite you on board and set our goal for $35,000 in 30 days.

Risks & Challenges

Since our last album, Ghost Talker (featured by Rolling Stone and Billboard), was released in 2019 we've been working on writing new music, some of which will be released as singles ahead of the full-length album. In the past we've relied heavily on income from touring to help fund our projects and team. When venues shut down in March of 2020 our plans for the album were pushed back, but we continued to write music and collaborate remotely with our friend and producer, Justin Abel. The time we spent at home resulted in sound exploration, challenging our own perspectives and letters turned into songs. In order to finish bringing this record to life we need to cover some expenses. Our goal is to get this project finished as soon as possible so we take it out on the road. Here is a breakdown of the costs:

$10,000 - Recording, Mixing & Producing

$4,200 - Mastering

$2,000 - Musicians

$1,000 - Videography & Photography

$12,000 - PR Team

$5,800 - Distribution of CDs & Vinyl

When venues shut down in March of 2020 our plans for the album were pushed back, but we continued to write music and collaborate remotely with our friend and producer, Justin Abel. The time we spent at home resulted in sound exploration, challenging our own perspectives and letters turned into songs. In order to finish bringing this record to life we need to cover some expenses. Our goal is to get this project finished as soon as possible so we take it out on the road. Here is a breakdown of the costs:
$10,000 - Recording, Mixing & Producing
$4,200 - Mastering
$2,000 - Musicians
$1,000 - Videography & Photography
$12,000 - PR Team
$5,800 - Distribution of CDs & Vinyl

story:
Partner with Whitney to Launch Her Debut Album!

Hi, I’m Whitney! I’m a Catholic recording artist and church organist, and I am so excited to bring you my first full-length album. Over the past few years, I have been sharing sacred music with my audiences online through YouTube and social media, and I am so excited to finally be launching this album!

For centuries, the Faith has been kept alive by passing hymns down from one generation to the next, and now I want to share some of these special hymns with you. Music is how I come to know God, and I believe that now, more than ever, we need to be strong and keep the Faith. My biggest hope for this album is that it will help to spread the Gospel and bring others to know Christ!

The Album

I am so proud of this album. It features 10 of my favorite hymns that I hope will inspire you and strengthen your faith. With so many forces of darkness working against us in the world today, I believe that that sacred music is one of the best weapons we have in our arsenal. Not only will it help you to learn more about your faith and bring you closer to God, but I hope it will be a force of goodness and beauty against the forces of darkness.

 Here is the track listing:

1. Love Divine, All Loves Excelling (BLAENWERN)

2. Holy, Holy, Holy (NICAEA)

3. At the Lamb's High Feast We Sing (SALZBURG)

4. Come Down, O Love Divine (DOWN AMPNEY)

5. Guide Me, O Thou Great Redeemer (CWM RHONDDA)

6. O God Beyond All Praising (THAXTED)

7. Ye Watchers and Ye Holy Ones (LASST UNS ERFREUEN)

8. Lead Kindly Light (LUX IN TENEBRIS)

9. Jesus, My Lord, My God, My All (SWEET SACRAMENT)

10. Holy God, We Praise Thy Name (GROSSER GOTT)

I have been blessed to be able to work with David C. Smith from Icon Studio Productions for this album. It has been wonderful to see this album come to life with David’s expertise. David says, "It’s been an absolute joy to work with Whitney on 'Love Divine, All Loves Excelling.' People have found comfort and hope in these hymns for generations and, particularly in these unsettling times, I have as well and know you will too."

 

YOU Can Make This Happen!

  • Your contribution to this campaign is vitally important. As an independent musician, I am free to produce any type of music I want without being tied to what a record company wants; however, it also means that I have a great deal of responsibility in creating an album.
  • The music industry has changed. Today, many musicians (myself included) are partnering with their fans in grassroots campaigns to get their music produced. It’s so exciting to be able to involve you in this way. You have such an important role in launching this album, and I can’t do it without you!
  • If I don’t reach my goal, I am still determined to launch this album, but it will take longer for me to save up for the remaining production costs. With your help, it will be released in October! 
  • I truly believe this album will make a difference in your life and in the world. 


What You Get

I have some great perks for you to show my appreciation for contributing to this campaign!

$25- Autographed CD and personal thank you note

$40- “Writer’s Delight”- Prayer journal, autographed CD, personal thank you note

$65- "Sacred Heart Supporter"- Framed Sacred Heart print, autographed CD, personal thank you note

$75- "Coffee Lover's Delight"- Sacred Heart travel mug, one 12 oz. package of Mystic Monk Coffee (please specify desired roast or flavor), autographed CD, personal thank you note

$75- "Tea Lover's Delight"- Sacred Heart travel mug, one package Mystica tea (please specify desired variety), autographed CD, personal thank you note

$100- Creative Coaching Session- You will be able to meet with Whitney for a one-hour session on Zoom, FaceTime, or Skype, where you can get advice on your artistic career, get feedback on a song you're writing, or just hang out and chat! You will also receive an autographed CD and a personal thank you note.

$150- "Gold Standard Supporter"- Framed Sacred Heart print, Sacred Heart travel mug, prayer journal, autographed CD, and personal thank you note

$300- Private Online Concert- Whitney will perform a private online concert of 10 songs of your choice just for you and your friends. You will also receive an autographed CD and a personal thank you note.

 

Risks & Challenges

Creating my first album hasn’t been without its risks. Since I’ve never done this before, it has been a learning process. To be perfectly honest with you, doing this campaign is scary! For one, if I don’t reach my goal, my album release will be delayed. But also, it’s hard to jump in and do this crowdfunding campaign when it is all so new to me and the learning curve is steep. Doing this campaign is way out of my comfort zone, but it is 100% worth it to be able to share this music to you.

I have been working on this album for almost a year and it has been hard work. Most of the time spent working on it was late at night after I put my kids to bed. I believe that anything worthwhile is worth working for, and that has been my motto with this album! Honestly, as a busy, homeschooling mom, I never could have dreamed of getting even this far. I have worked hard, but I give all the credit to Jesus Christ for being my strength,

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re unable to contribute, there are other ways to help:

  • SHARE this campaign on your social media pages every few days - look for the SHARE buttons at the top of this page 
  • EMBED this campaign on your website or blog
  • If you are a music reviewer or promoter, I have room for interviews! Email whitney@whitneymaslak.com with the subject line “Interview”

story:
DISOBEY OFFICIAL MUSIC VIDEO

Hello everyone! It's Jack Lloyd and The Pholosopher here and we're excited to announce that we're producing a sequel music video to our song, MASK ORDER.

 
This time, the track is called "DISOBEY," and we're rallying the culture against the tyrannical lockdowns, shutdowns, and mask orders on a WHOLE NEW LEVEL!
 
We've already recorded the song here:

 

And we're ready to move forward on making the OFFICIAL music video.
 

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least $3,000 to do this music video right using our native equipment. Ideally though, we wish to raise $10,000 so we can hire a crew with even BETTER professional equipment to take the visuals to the next level. So long as we raise at least $3,000 though, we will make the music video as that's the minimum this campaign needs to be released to us.

To thank you for helping us get there, we have some AMAZING ways for you to get involved and be rewarded, including:

- Behind-the-Scenes teasers

- Small and large stickers

- Set photos

- Art prints

- Roll Credit

- And advertisement in the video!

It's our way to thank you and inspire others in resisting the tyranny.

MINIMUM GOAL REACHED - WHAT'S NEXT

As we have hit our minimum goal, what we are on the path for now is trying to reach 10K so we can hire a full-service production crew with better equipment than what we have to shoot with.

That said, even before hitting 10K, we still need funds to improve the production with additional:

- Props

- Actors

- Filming effects/equipment

- Sets

So even if we don't hit 10K, your support past the minimum helps us move beyond inferencing shots (that is, shots that imply content but cannot show more due to budget constraints) to being able to have dynamic scenes with more believable props, actors, and set support.

It's going to make the music video both more engaging and hard-hitting with the social commentary we want to portray.

To thank you for helping us move up the ladder of improvement, we have some STRETCH GOALS to help incentivize more participation AND perk upgrades.


 

The Impact

What we hope to accomplish is to reach and exceed the views we've gotten from Mask Order to let others know that they are not alone in resisting the madness coming from all the state mandates around the world. We think that culture matters, and a big part of inspiring that culture is music with a hard-hitting, thought-provoking message.

Risks & Challenges

We are experienced in both Indiegogo campaigns and music production having run over 20 campaigns for various projects (on this account and others) and having produced over a dozen songs and other videos.

That said, we are always mindful of challenges that can arise due to state distortion of the market and so do our best to prepare ahead of time.

We are confident that, absent global war, a major natural disaster, or outright martial law, we will be able to navigate the production of the video and fulfillment of the perks with ease.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have change to spare, EVERY share of this campaign on social media helps us get the word out. So please, do share this campaign to your social media pages, whether that's on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, Minds, MeWe, YouTube community, Hive, Flote, or whatever else you may use.

We are also open to being interviewed about the project with well-established podcasters and vloggers who have an audience we can reach with our message for liberty.

***ADVERTISEMENT POLICY***

We are thrilled to offer an opportunity for advertisers on the DISOBEY music video. That said, we have some policies in place to ensure that advertisers can meet our fit for branding, placement, and appropriateness.

The advertisement on the front and the roll credit at the end are text-based. The implementation will be chosen based on a font and design aesthetic fitting to the rest of the music video. The advertiser will be able to showcase a name, product, or company so long as the advertisement name/product/company is owned by the purchasing individual. We cannot and will not take advertisement made by a third party on behalf of another, which means that, unfortunately, we cannot take a "shout-out" advertisement that one wants to make in support of another's work.

We will not be taking advertisements for any of the following topics:

- Pornographic/sexual content, such as advertisement for an adult toy store website.

- Religious groups or religious services of any kind.

- Promotion of government/government services.

- Content that is antithetical to our message of liberty.

If uncertain, please contact us first through the campaign dashboard to ensure that your name/product/company is appropriate.

We WILL generally take advertisements for:

- A personal shout-out of someone's own name or personal alias.

- Company advertisements for non-sexual/non-religious companies/organizations.

- Product/service advertisements for non-sexual/non-religious products.

The advertisement may consist of the name of the company/product/service as well as the relevant Website for the company.

For example, if someone is purchasing the opening credit advertisement as an engineering firm, they may have the name of the engineering firm company and the company's Website with a "Brought to You By" text prominently featured in the beginning of the video.

Thank you so much for your generous time and consideration of advertising with us.

story:
Short Summary

In times of change and uncertainty, music can be a comfort, aid understanding and be a call for action. This project is the seed from which this music will grow, providing a social commentary and encouraging hope through small changes.

We (Laura-Beth Salter & Ali Hutton) formed our duo about five years ago as a focus to develop something new. From very different musical upbringings, From the Ground is a celebration of the music that we share, and the common ground found between us. It is the roots of our musical exploration into the world around us which is influenced by current issues surrounding the human effect on climate change, health and wellbeing and freedom of movement. This recording aims to highlight social and environmental concerns and promote change for good.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We are incredibly grateful to Creative Scotland for backing this project, however, in order for us to complete the project we still need some help. This is where you come in!
  • We are offering signed CD pre-orders which you will receive before the album is released, and a whole host of specialised items. 
  • If you choose to back us by purchasing one of our perks, the money will go towards helping us create an immersive experience for you, our audience. Snippets of the field recordings that inspired us, top class videography of the environments we are soundscaping and interviews with specialists will be made available to help you feel more connected with the music we are writing.

 

Risks & Challenges

We realise that the current pandemic has made it really difficult for people to go about their everyday lives as normal. As professional musicians, we both feel our livelihoods, careers and wider industry are at risk. We know this is the case for many professions just now, and hope for everyone, that this situation improves soon.

One of the large challenges of this project is working remotely and dealing with the restrictions in place in Glasgow. We have always worked on music organically, playing in the same room and for hours, until something feels right. We are now developing new ways of sharing and continuing to work on new music and have gradually fallen into a new rhythm of working. We are determined to maintain the quality of our previous work, if not, to improve upon it.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that this is a difficult time for many, but would like to let you know that, if you would like to help us without it costing money, you still can.

  • Spread the word! We would be really grateful for any shares of our music or indiegogo campaign on social media. There are share tools below.
  • You can add our original EP 'Beginnings' to your spotify playlist

story:
THE WHY

It’s a hard thing to swallow...when circumstances ask that you forget about something you love in order to meet the responsibilities set before you.  All those little (and not so little) deaths we experience in life when we find our time is not our own and we can’t do the things we wish we had the freedom to do.

As a father of 6, you can imagine how little time is my own.  My time belongs to my wife and my kids…and I get a few scraps here and there.  I would not have it any other way though.  I’d give up far more than time for them.  They make my life beautiful.

I get asked often when I’m going to record again.  I get asked all the time if I’m writing.  That second question is easy…always.  I'm always writing.  As for recording, you might as well have asked if I was raising grass-fed unicorns yet.

I’ve realized though, that creating makes me come alive, and I need to make time for that part of me.  But it's much more than that.  As much as art gives life to the artist, its true end and purpose bears an altruistic component.  Art is for others.  In fact, all of life, in the end, finds meaning when given for others.  I want to create music not just because of the life it gives me, but because I want to share that life with you.  Maybe you'll connect with these songs.  Maybe they'll just be a nice background tune to make dinner to.  Maybe your kids will sing along with them in the back of the car on your way to vacation...either way, some level of beauty will have been added to your life, and that thought makes me smile.

It's time to get in the studio and create!  Wanna help?

What it is going to take

Here's the break down:

  • $3,000 dollars - that's what it will take to get 1 song into the light of day (if we're doing it well)  That includes:
    • Studio Fees: between $50 and $100  an hour
    • Producers, Studio Musicians -  all need to be paid
      • these two will be the bulk of the cost.
    • Mixing and Mastering - $120 to $150 per song
    • CD manufacturing and Digital distribution $1,000 to $1,500 for the CD
    • CD Artwork/design - around $1,000
  • Ideally I'd like to record a full-length album.  11 songs will be on it including Holy Smokes which is already finished.  That leaves 10.  I'm setting a high bar with asking for $25,000 (I know that is shy of 10 X 3,000 but a couple of these songs will be simpler).  In the end, the amount we are able to raise will roughly determine how many songs end up on the album.

YOU IN?

What it is going to take
Here's the break down:

$3,000 dollars - that's what it will take to get 1 song into the light of day (if we're doing it well)  That includes:
Studio Fees: between $50 and $100  an hour
Producers, Studio Musicians -  all need to be paidthese two will be the bulk of the cost.

Mixing and Mastering - $120 to $150 per song
CD manufacturing and Digital distribution $1,000 to $1,500 for the CD
CD Artwork/design - around $1,000


Ideally I'd like to record a full-length album.  11 songs will be on it including Holy Smokes which is already finished.  That leaves 10.  I'm setting a high bar with asking for $25,000 (I know that is shy of 10 X 3,000 but a couple of these songs will be simpler).  In the end, the amount we are able to raise will roughly determine how many songs end up on the album.

YOU IN?

story:
Short Summary

I'm a singer-songwriter from Ottawa, Canada and I've been recording music, releasing it, and touring all over the world for over 15 years.  Along the way I’ve released 7 albums, won a few awards, and performed all over Europe and North America.   I released my latest record Just Words in February 2020 and was actually on tour in Europe when the pandemic hit.  I had over 100 album release shows cancelled across Europe and North America in 2020 and we're still not really sure when regular touring will start back up again. 

That's the downside.  The upside is I've had some time to learn about recording at home.  And I started collaborating with my good pal and Good Intention Blair Michael Hogan (who was on that fateful tour to Europe in March 2020). We've actually co-written EIGHT of the eleven songs together AND we're going to co-produce the new album together too. We’ve actually already done a lot of the pre-production for the new songs, so we already have a really good idea of what we want the songs to sound like.  We just need to figure out how to pay to do it.  That's where YOU can help!!  #PandaCrew

What We Need & What You Get

We're hoping to raise $10,000!   WOW that sounds like a lot of money.  And it IS because making records is expensive!!  Normally I would pay to make THIS record with the money I made from touring Just Words.  But no touring = no money.  So I’m hoping YOU will play the role of record label and help me to finance this project. 

We plan to release the record in March 2022, and in addition to all the cool things listed along the right hand side of this page, Panda Crew members can expect to get an earlier preview of the new music.  Hey they don't call them PERKS for nothing!

This campaign has been set up for Flex Funding which means if I don't reach my goal, I'll still get the money that's raised. That will mean reevaluating some of what I do. But no matter what I'll be putting this album out into the world, however the campaign plays out.

The Impact

I’ve been a DIY artist for my entire musical career, so I'm used to wearing many hats.  For this album I feel like I’m pushing myself further than I ever have before, both in terms of the actual music that will end up ON the album as well as how we’re approaching making it.  In addition to producing the record, Blair and I will also be doing some of the tracking ourselves at Panda Cave Studios (that’s a fancy title for my home studio).

In order for us to have a finished product that is as good as it can possibly be we DO need to be able to hire the right people to do the things that are just a wee bit above our pay grade! So don't worry I won't be playing drums on the album!  In addition to laying down the groove, Phil Shaw Bova has agreed to mix and master everything we throw at him.  Phil has not only been nominated for Grammy awards for his work, he also has really cool analog gear with a lot of knobs and lights and meters that make songs really freaking good. If you like numbers I've included a budget on how we'd spend that $10,000 below.

STRETCH GOALS:  If we’re able to exceed our goal of $10,000 to cover the costs of making and manufacturing the album, we'll press vinyl like all the cool kids do.  And after that we'll  promote the new album.  Which is a HUGE part of making sure the music ultimately gets heard.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren’t in a position to help financially right now but still want to support the making of this album there are other ways you can help out. Spread the word! Tell your family and friends and let them know what's going on.  With all the social networking and ways we now connect with one another, by posting links to this page you are reaching places we would never be able to reach.

Budget

Records are expensive to make, even when you do some of the recording yourself. And they are also expensive to promote. So to be completely transparent here's a projected budget we've prepared to give you an idea as to how we've planned to allocate the funds. 

Recording  
Additional studio time $1,000
Session Fees:  $2,000
Mixing & Mastering $3,000

Manufacturing
Artwork $1,500
CD manufacturing $1,500

TOTAL to record and manufacture album $9,000

Fundraising GOAL $10,000
Indie GoGo Fees (5%) -$500
Credit Card fees (3%) -$300  
Adjusted gross $9,200

STRETCH GOALS

If we EXCEED our target, we still have a LOT of things we'd like to do.  Including pressing VINYL and undertaking a marketing campaign.  So here's what our stretch goal budget would cover if we raise more than that initial milestone of $10,000:

Print vinyl records $3,500
Hire a Publicist $4,500
Undertake singles (3) campaign $3,000
Create professional music videos for each single (3) $7,500

story:
Stretch Goal

Khu.éex' has reached our original goal of $15,000 to complete and release the new album, "WOOch". Support from our Contributors was fundamental in the production of this new album which is scheduled to be released in June 2021.  Thank you to all of our Contributors so far. 

We want to extend our original goal by $10,000, for an overall total of $25,000. We will use any funds that go over the original $15,000 goal to get into the studio and add the multi track layering and mixing for a new batch of music recorded in October of 2020.  Khu.éex’ recorded 6 basic tracks for a new EP reflecting the newest line up. These new tracks feature Sondra Segundo our lead singer, singing in her Haida language, "Killer Whale Song", and our newest song titled "Breathe In". This would also feature Edward Littlefield on drums/vocals and Jason Cressey on Trombone. Please consider contributing to help us reach this next phase. 

 

The Khu.éex’ Story

Khu.éex’ (pronounced koo-eex) translates to “Potlatch” in the Tlingit language, a Native group from Southeast Alaska. Co-Founder Preston Singletary thought of the name Khu.éex' because of the notion of sharing culture, stories, and music. This is the intent of Khu.éex', to present a contemporary interpretation of our culture to empower others.

In March 2016, Khu.éex' entered the studio to simultaneously begin work on what would result in two triple albums:  2019's  “Héen”, and Khu.éex's upcoming new fourth album "WOOch".

 

 

The New Album: WOOch

Translating from "together" in the Tlingit language, "wooch" also echoes the "WOO" philosophy of Khu.éex' co-founder, the legendary Bernie Worrell, (keyboardist and original member of Parliament-Funkadelic) in which he wished to use music to bring people together through sound. Hear the first song, 10,000 Generations,  from this album now at the Khu.éex' Bandcamp page. 

Focusing on the concept of the Alaska Native communities' shared experiences,  the album explores the connection between historical and contemporary issues and intergenerational strength in the face of trauma. 

"WOOch" also represents Bernie Worrell's final major studio project before his passing 3 months following the beginning if these sessions.  Bernie's playing reflected profound depth and power in the face of his cancer battle. 

Produced by Randall Dunn (renowned for his work with Sunn O))), Earth, and Jóhann Jóhannsson), "WOOch" is Khu.éex's most expansive work yet, ranging stylistically from Funk to Spiritual Jazz to Americana to Drone Metal. 

“WOOch” features Bernie Worrell (Keyboards), Preston Singletary (Bass), Captain Raab (Guitar), Gene Tagaban (vocals, spoken word, flute), Nahaan (spoken word, vocals), Skerik (Sax and horn arrangements), Hans Teuber (horns, flutes), Stephen Nistor (Drums, percussion), Denny Stern (percussion), Indrayani Ananda and Carly Kienow (vocals), and Tim Kennedy (keyboards). Special featured guests: Qacung (Y’upic vocals) acclaimed singer and co-founder of Pamyua, Eyvind Kang (Viola), and Jay Kardong (pedal steel). 

 

How You Can Help 

Khu.éex' has reached our goal of $15,000 to complete and release  the new album, "WOOch". Thank you for your support! 

We will use any funds that go over the original $15,000 goal to get into the studio and add the multi track layering and mixing for a new batch of music recorded in October of 2020.  Khu.éex’ recorded 6 basic tracks for a new EP reflecting the newest line up. These new tracks feature Sondra Segundo our lead singer, singing in her Haida language, "Killer Whale Song", and our newest song titled "Breathe In". This would also feature Edward Littlefield on drums/vocals and Jason Cressey on Trombone. 

 Be part of this groundbreaking project today! Scroll down for more photos of Perks offered.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to contribute financially? You can still support us! Share our story with your friends and family via social media. Taking a few moments to share our story, via a click or swipe, is a valuable gift that Khu.éex’ really appreciates.

 

Perks!

Choose your level of support, Perks range from a digital download code for the album “Héen” to one of a kind blown glass Tlingit Baskets by noted artist Preston Singletary (Khu.éex’ co-founder/bassist). More details for each Perk are listed under the "Select a Perk" section.

----------

Be among the first to hear "WOOch" , the new album by Khu.éex'! Please note that this album will be in production and will take several months to complete and ship. 

 

Get the recent Héen album by Khu.éex', either as a digital download or in blue vinyl. 

 

Music Collectors Album Package, includes all three Khu.éex'  albums in black vinyl.

 

Music Collectors Album Package, includes all three Khu.éex' albums in color vinyl.

 

Two Books by Sondra Segundo

"Lovebirds - The True Story of Raven and Eagle"
A true love story about an eagle who met a raven. Together, they take a magical journey through the animal, human and spirit worlds. CD of audiobook and Lovebirds Song included. Signed by the author.

"Killer Whale Eyes"
A young Haida girl is born with eyes like no other. Her songs and strong love for the ocean help her people discover that ever-so-quiet wonder that tells them the world is truly magic. CD of audiobook and I am a Child of the Ocean song included. Signed by the author. 

 

Seahawks Game day poster by Preston Singletary 

 

Welcome Figure Serigraph by Preston Singletary

 

Bentwood Box Serigraph by Preston Singletary

 

 Black Box Serigraph by Preston Singletary - Sold Out

 

Abstract Serigraph by Preston Singletary

 

Sun Mask Serigraph by Preston Singletary

 

Large Welcome Figure Serigraph by Preston Singletary

 

Eagle by Preston Singletary

 

Moon Mask by Preston Singletary

 

Spirit Face  by Preston Singletary

 

Sun Mask by Preston Singletary

 

Killer Whale Medallion by Preston Singletary - Sold Out

 

Sun Medallion by Preston Singletary

 

Killer Whale Totem

 

Salmon by Preston Singletary

 

Tlingit Baskets created in blown and sand carved glass by noted artist and Khu.éex' co-founder Preston Singletary. Each of these one of a kind pieces are offered as a special Perk to add to your fine art collection. 

 

Thank You For Your Support and Commitment to Music!
