story:
U.S. ONLY!

SALE ENDS 11:59PM THURSDAY 8 MAY 2014.


New Richard Cheese 'The Sunny Side Of The Moon' T-Shirt, for Men & Women & Kids, just $13!!!

We're ready to print a new Richard Cheese T-Shirt, but we want to do it in full-color!  So, we need at least 300 pre-orders before we can afford to print them.

Please order today, and save $5 off the price!

These shirts will retail for $18, but if you order now, they're only $13 each!

MENS - S, M, L, XL, 2XL, 3XL, 4XL
WOMENS - S, M, L, XL, 2XL
KIDS - YouthMedium (only one kids size)

To order, please choose from the complete list of sizes.  Shirts are $13 plus $4 shipping (U.S. only).  Please note:  2XL, 3XL, 4XL cost slightly more.

In general, I'm not in favor of women wearing clothes . . . unless it's my new T-Shirt!  So order now at http://shirt.richardcheese.com -- but ladies, please leave it off.


IMPORTANT:  Be sure to provide your CORRECT email address and your CURRENT mailing address, and don't forget to get the right size, because all sales are final.

YES, you can still order even after we've reached the $3,900 goal.  This special low pre-order price is available until May 8.



===

Cost: One Shirt $17 (includes tax & shipping)
Shirts are 100% Cotton.
Shirts are black with full-color screenprint on front.  Back is blank.
Printed in the U.S.A.

Sorry, we CANNOT ship outside the United States or to APO/FPO addresses.  

To order from outside the U.S., visit http://music.richardcheese.com .

NOTES:

Please don't contribute more than the listed price.



(C) 2005, 2014 Richard Cheese.  All rights reserved.  U.S. ONLY.  Void where prohibited.  Some restrictions apply.  Credit Card Statement will show payment to "LOUNGEMART" or "INDIEGOGO."    Delivery schedule, shirt design, and availability subject to change.   All sales are final, no returns on clothing.  If you provide an incorrect address, you will be charged for shipping/handling and costs of re-shipping.   For customer service, please send one email message to customerservice@loungemart.com.  DO NOT POST QUESTIONS ON INDIEGOGO, PLEASE.

IMPORTANT:  Be sure your IndieGoGo account's email address and mailing address are CORRECT before you order!




FaceBook:  http://www.facebook.com/richardcheese
Instagram:  @richardcheese
Twitter:  @richardcheese


RICHARD CHEESE & LOUNGE AGAINST THE MACHINE 

America's loudest lounge singer Richard Cheese performs swingin' Vegas versions of rock and rap songs, "swankifying" popular Top40 hits into retro vocal standards.  Imagine Sinatra singing Radiohead, and you've got Richard Cheese & Lounge Against The Machine.  Since 2000, Cheese has released 15 albums and sold more than 200,000 CDs; his music is available on iTunes, in stores, and at http://music.richardcheese.com/ . 

Richard Cheese's songs have been featured in the movie "Dawn Of The Dead," on ABC-TV's "Dancing With The Stars," and he's performed on Jimmy Kimmel Live, CNN with Anderson Cooper, The Jonathan Ross Show, KROQ's Kevin & Bean Show, MTV's Say What Karaoke?, Howard Stern, Opie & Anthony, and as the house band 20 times on NBC's Last Call with Carson Daly.  The lounge legend has played hundreds of sellout concerts all over the world, from Las Vegas to London, from Portland to Portugal, from Honolulu to Hollywood, from New York to New Orleans.  With his snappy jazz trio, his tiger-striped tuxedo, and his enormous microphone, Richard Cheese presents the perfect mix of music, martini, and madcap. Viva Las Queso!

RICHARD CHEESE & LOUNGE AGAINST THE MACHINE America's loudest lounge singer Richard Cheese performs swingin' Vegas versions of rock and rap songs, "swankifying" popular Top40 hits into retro vocal standards.  Imagine Sinatra singing Radiohead, and you've got Richard Cheese & Lounge Against The Machine.  Since 2000, Cheese has released 15 albums and sold more than 200,000 CDs; his music is available on iTunes, in stores, and at http://music.richardcheese.com/ . Richard Cheese's songs have been featured in the movie "Dawn Of The Dead," on ABC-TV's "Dancing With The Stars," and he's performed on Jimmy Kimmel Live, CNN with Anderson Cooper, The Jonathan Ross Show, KROQ's Kevin & Bean Show, MTV's Say What Karaoke?, Howard Stern, Opie & Anthony, and as the house band 20 times on NBC's Last Call with Carson Daly.  The lounge legend has played hundreds of sellout concerts all over the world, from Las Vegas to London, from Portland to Portugal, from Honolulu to Hollywood, from New York to New Orleans.  With his snappy jazz trio, his tiger-striped tuxedo, and his enormous microphone, Richard Cheese presents the perfect mix of music, martini, and madcap. Viva Las Queso!

story:
Who we are

We hope this message is broadcast far and wide, so for anyone who's found us through this crowdfunder and doesn't know who we are and what we do... 

We're a UK-based LGBT+ punk rock band from the south coast, and in our first year together we recorded an EP and toured through Southampton Pride, Reading Pride and Surrey Pride, as well as Northamptonshire's Queer Spirit Festival.

Our identities are at the forefront of what we do because there's simply not enough representation out there of queer people in the music scene. Until it's normal, we will be loud about who we are and what we do. This means we attract wonderful fans and deter the haters and 'phobes. That being said, we're an inclusive band. We roll with a straight, cis-het Christian man on our team. He's a fantastic role model for what being an ally really means. Our identities don't have to cause conflict if we're willing to listen to each other and put kindness first. 

 

What's this crowdfunder about then?

We have 11 tracks raring to go, just waiting to be recorded into our first album.  But it's not only the music, it's a whole world we are building. We want to immerse fans and listeners in this world. We'll be starting that experience at the launch of this crowdfunder in the form of an online puzzle trail. This album cycle will also feature at least three related music videos and a plethora of merch and unique artwork. We'll either produce this in-house, using our band's diverse skillsets, or with independent artists and freelancers, with whom we have forged excellent relationships. 

Part of our plan, before the pandemic, was to save up money from gigs and merch to help us fund this album. Obviously, we haven't been able to follow through with that, but this time has allowed us room to really work on these songs. As individuals, we all have day jobs and contribute what we can to the band, but to get the rest of the way there we need a little help. So, that's where you (potentially) come in. 

It's safe to say we've grown and improved as musicians since recording our EP. We've developed our sound to another level that represents who we are right now and what we aim to achieve. We really believe in this music. We believe it should be heard and that it'll have a positive impact on people's lives. There are songs for a workout playlist. Songs to shout to, drive to, make out to, cry to and protest to. 

If we reach our goal, we'll be able to cover the cost of recording and post-production at the local studio - The Ranch - where we recorded our EP. We have chosen them for our established relationship, their welcoming environment for LGBT+ individuals and because we're confident they'll help us deliver this album, without limitations. 

This is also a chance for us to get our fans involved. As you'll see with the perks, there'll be plenty of opportunities to make your own mark on this album. We want to start as we mean to go on. This is not just our band, this is your band too.

What it will mean to us

Honestly, we'd be overwhelmed to receive so much trust and support from people. We're creating this crowdfunder as a bit of a stab in the dark. We're not sure what to expect.

Grand it may seem, we see our existence as a band and the music we make as something bigger than us. It's about LGBT+ youth in difficult situations being able to hear us and know that they're not alone, know that they are valid, worthy and accepted. There is a community out there waiting for them. It's about people who go through ridicule and abuse having music to relate to, a message to counter when they're told they're unworthy, unlovable and that they don't fit in. It's about people outside of the community hearing our music, relating to it and discovering that we aren't so dissimilar after all. We all love. We all feel pain. And we all want to be loved.

And we all want to dance (even if it's secretly, alone, in your bedroom). 

If we finish this album as we envision it, we feel like we'd have the chance to get our message out there, get our music heard and increase our audience of Underdog Kids. We'll do everything in our power to make that happen, but your support would help us so much. 

 

What could go wrong?

We think it's best to be honest and up front about the challenges and hurdles we may face in making this album.

The main thing that could happen is that we might need more time in the studio. However, if that's the case, we can cover those costs from our own pockets, even if it takes a little time. This would potentially push out our perk delivery deadlines a little! 

The £3000 target is a dream goal, covering not just recording but with further merchanidse ideas and help us record music videos. Never fret, however; even if we fall short, we'll find a way to make this album happen. 

Since this is the first time we've done something like this, we hope the perks are appetising and our delivery schedule realistic. We foresee some of those deadlines as being the main variables. They rely on other people's schedules, but changes in the Coronavirus pandemic may also have an impact. 

Money isn't everything

We believe that. While it does help, ultimately, publicity is priceless. Even if you can't contribute to the crowdfunder, just sharing it out helps a great deal. We understand that everyone is struggling right now. The pandemic has done a number on us all. It does feel a bit strange to be asking for money for something like this at a time like this, but most of us turn to art when the world is darkest. In our most desperate moments, as a community, there is song and dance, music and camraderie. These bring colour to the world, bridge gaps in social divides, and make us feel alive. Art is important, no matter what the government says. 

For those who want to get involved with some of the more expensive perks we have on offer, but lack the funds... Well... Follow the trail and see where it leads you...

story:
The overwhelming support I received for my first album in 2012 literally changed the course of my life.  I never dreamed of becoming a full time musician, but instead had just completed a degree in Civil Engineering Technology. However, after the record was released, I received such positive feedback that I started performing nonstop and haven't slowed down since. 

I am now a veteran working musician, I've played up to 8 shows a week in every venue setting you could imagine - on street corners, island bar rooftops, listening rooms, rowdy taverns and concert halls. I've written more songs than will fit onto one album, but here are a few of the contenders:

-Lady Brain
-Whiskey for Two
-Secrets
-Devilish Grin
-Red's House
-Running
-Breathe
-Tattoo
-We're Done
-Savannah
-Heroin
-Dark Wave
-Gypsy Song
-Shadow Box
-I Don't Wanna Let Go
-Carousel  
-I'm Sorry

Every penny donated to this campaign will go toward the production and distribution costs of the album. If you have ANY questions at all, PLEASE don't hesitate to ask me!

 

If you are unable to make a monetary donation, please share with your friends and family.


Thank you for your support!

story:
Hi,

My name is Duncan Lyall. I’m an award-winning musician, composer and record producer from Scotland.

Over the past 18 months I have been working hard, recording and producing Milestone - a suite of new music that I was commissioned to write for the world-renowned Celtic Connections festival, January 2019 in Glasgow.

I'd probably describe it as CINEMATICFOLKELECTRONICAROCKFUNK

But I'm not keen to label myself so I'll let you decide.

The Milestone band are:

  • Duncan Lyall: Bass Guitar, Moog (love) and other synths, Piano, Programming
  • Jarlath Henderson: Uillean Pipes, Whistles, Vocals
  • Lori Watson: Vocals and Fiddle
  • Patsy Reid: Fiddle and Viola
  • Angus Lyon: Keys and Piano
  • Chas MacKenzie: Electric Guitar
  • Stuart Brown: Drum Kit and Percussion

 

I am heavily involved in, and influenced by the vibrant Scottish Folk and Trad music scene. At its core, Milestone is a product of this. But my musical experiences, both as an artist and a fan, reach far and wide beyond this arena. I’ve not been afraid to wear my heart on my sleeve with this music and I'm not ashamed to cite these influences as key to the sound: 

Daft Punk, Cinematic Orchestra, Bjork, Air, Pink Floyd, Jamiroquai, DJ Shadow, The Foo Fighters, Massive Attack, Craig Armstrong, The Beatles…

Basically my old CD collection.

Influences closer to home include bands like Treacherous Orchestra and Croft No. FIve (both of which I was a member of) and the late visionary, Martyn Bennett.

Each of these musical influences evokes memories of different milestones in my life. I wanted to pay tribute to some of these moments in the form of a musical response.

From sitting down to write the first bar of music, right through to this point in time, Milestone has been a labour of love. I've worked hard at this. I'm glad I did, because I'm proud of it.

With your valuable support, this work can see the light of day.

What I Need & What You Get

The album is recorded and mixed. I managed to get there with the help of Creative Scotland and with my own investment. But I need help getting this album over the line.

I need to raise £6000.

This will cover the cost of mastering the recording, artwork, CD manufacture (yeah we still love CDs in folk music!), licensing, PR and launch promotion, and if all goes well, the creation of music videos for selected tracks. This all means you would be supporting not only me, but some brilliant, dedicated creatives.

The more people that hear this music, the more likely it is to have a future. When live gigs become a thing again, I'd love to take this new band out to perform! I need your support to make that happen.

The simplest way to support this project is to pre-order the album as either a digital download or CD (which includes the digital download). For a little more you can receive a signed CD with an optional dedication.

There are other rewards, including 1:1 production or composition lessons, an online workshop where we break down how Milestone was written and produced, PDFs of the tunes, individual tune commissions, recording sessions... check out the rewards page for more details.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like the sound of this but can't afford to contribute with money, you can help me by spreading the word about this project. Find, like and follow me on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter. Share this story on your socials. Tell your friends, tell your enemies, tell everyone! And join the mailing list so I can send you previews and special content.

About Me:

I am probably best known for playing double bass, bass guitar and Moog with Kate Rusby, Treacherous Orchestra, Croft No Five and many well known traditional musicians from across Scotland and beyond. I have worked with an array of world-renowned musicians including Mark Knopfler, Guy Garvey, Mary-Chapin Carpenter, Vince Mendoza, Craig Armstrong and many more.

My production work includes 

  • Scots Trad Awards Album of the Year 2015 and Scottish Album of the Year 2015 Longlisted “Grind” by Treacherous Orchestra
  • Scottish Album of the Year 2016 Longlisted “Hearts Broken, Head’s Turned” by Jarlath Henderson, 
  • The Guardian top 10 folk album of 2018 (No.2) “Yarrow Acoustic Sessions” by Lori Watson.

As a composer, my debut album Infinite Reflections received praise from critics, fans and musicians alike, receiving a 5 star review in The Scotsman, and described as:

  • "progressive contemporary music at its best",
  • "contemporary Scottish folk music of the first order, resplendent in a big band sound" 
  • "clearly the product of a wide and profound musical intelligence"

 

​I have been nominated as Composer of the Year at the Scots Trad Awards and was awarded the Hands up for Trad Ignition Award for Innovation in Scottish Traditional Music.

But really... 

I am passionate about music, particularly the human connections that it fosters. As a musician, I've had the most beautiful conversations with others without a single word uttered. At times, I've been so "in tune" with other musicians that we've experienced a kind of telepathy. And locking into a groove with a band is such a unifying and life affirming experience,

And then there's the connection between musician and audience. How I miss this just now. The best gigs, at least for me, don't need high production values or virtuosic wizardry (as much as I enjoy these things). My favourite gigs are those where the connection between everyone in the room is palpable. The performers are sharing honest, true and heartfelt emotions, the audience is soaking it in, sharing the experience as one, and giving back to the stage. I've recorded a few streamed gigs this past year and, while there has been a lot to love about them, there's a great big auditorium size hole in the experience and it's that missing, symbiotic connection.

Times are hard just now, and one of the most difficult things is the deficit of human connection that we all thrive on. With any luck, we'll be back to sharing the experience of live music again soon. For now, I offer this recorded work and hope some of you will connect with it in your own way.

This project means a lot to me and your support is so important.

Thanks. Duncan x

story:
Justin Hiltner and Jon Weisberger here, and we’re back with another round of music from a couple of bluegrass rabble-rousers and community builders.

As you know from our 2018 record, Watch It Burn, and from all the work that we’ve been up to in the bluegrass community, we truly believe that bluegrass is for everyone — and bluegrass gospel is for everyone, too. Bluegrass gospel is an integral part of this music, and when we put together our love for many bluegrass gospel songs with our personal backgrounds — Justin as someone who grew up performing bluegrass gospel, Jon as a frequent writer of bluegrass gospel songs — we thought it was time to take the opportunity to make a bluegrass gospel EP for you. What we made just so happens to illustrate that point – that bluegrass and bluegrass gospel are for everyone – nearly perfectly. 

We went to Crossroads Studios in Arden, NC to work with engineer Scott Barnett — and as we always do, we used the project as a vehicle for building community by bringing together an exciting group of musicians drawn from across the bluegrass spectrum. In addition to Justin (banjo) and Jon (bass), our band included: Balsam Range’s Darren Nicholson on mandolin, High Fidelity’s Corrina Rose Logston on fiddle, and multi-instrumentalist Laura Ray on guitar. For additional harmony vocals we brought in Nashville’s Ashleigh Caudill and Mt. Airy, NC’s Wendy Hickman. With this wonderful group of singers and pickers, we recorded six songs: two favorite hymns from Justin’s childhood and four new songs, three written by Ashleigh and Jon — including the title track, “Room At The Table ”— and one written by Ashleigh, Jon and Justin.   

We are so excited to share this music with you! It sounds even better – joyful, intuitive, organic, energetic like good old fashioned bluegrass gospel – than an Indiegogo description could convey. But we hope, above all, this message conveys that we want you to be part of this project, too. The way that you can do that is to contribute to our campaign, to help us cover costs: musicians, studio time, design, manufacturing and promotion.  It’s so meaningful to us to have your support — in fact, we can’t do this without you! This time, we’re keeping it really simple: you can contribute; you can pre-order a digital copy of the project or a physical CD; and if you want to play an even greater role, you can sign up to have your name included in the project credits — and get a note of appreciation signed by both of us!

It doesn’t matter how much you give! Every bit counts and is a direct reflection of the communities that support us and that we want to support right back. We want all of you to know that we know we can’t make music without people who want to hear it. This is one opportunity to let folks know that, like us, you believe that bluegrass — and bluegrass gospel — is for everyone. 

There’s room at the table for you!

In addition to Justin (banjo) and Jon (bass), our band included: Balsam Range’s Darren Nicholson on mandolin, High Fidelity’s Corrina Rose Logston on fiddle, and multi-instrumentalist Laura Ray on guitar. For additional harmony vocals we brought in Nashville’s Ashleigh Caudill and Mt. Airy, NC’s Wendy Hickman. With this wonderful group of singers and pickers, we recorded six songs: two favorite hymns from Justin’s childhood and four new songs, three written by Ashleigh and Jon — including the title track, “Room At The Table ”— and one written by Ashleigh, Jon and Justin.   
We are so excited to share this music with you! It sounds even better – joyful, intuitive, organic, energetic like good old fashioned bluegrass gospel – than an Indiegogo description could convey. But we hope, above all, this message conveys that we want you to be part of this project, too. The way that you can do that is to contribute to our campaign, to help us cover costs: musicians, studio time, design, manufacturing and promotion.  It’s so meaningful to us to have your support — in fact, we can’t do this without you! This time, we’re keeping it really simple: you can contribute; you can pre-order a digital copy of the project or a physical CD; and if you want to play an even greater role, you can sign up to have your name included in the project credits — and get a note of appreciation signed by both of us!
It doesn’t matter how much you give! Every bit counts and is a direct reflection of the communities that support us and that we want to support right back. We want all of you to know that we know we can’t make music without people who want to hear it. This is one opportunity to let folks know that, like us, you believe that bluegrass — and bluegrass gospel — is for everyone. 
There’s room at the table for you!

story:
Short Summary

Hello friends,

My name is Iakovos 'Jakob' Symeonidis and I am a jazz guitarist from Athens, Greece based in Berlin, Germany.

I started the Jako Organ Trio project in 2016 with the help of the renowned Greek organ and piano player George Kontrafouris. Together with us we have Gary Kerkezou on drums, a gifted drummer making her first steps in the New York Jazz scene. 

The band is influenced by the legendary jazz organ trios and artists like Jimmy Smith, Larry Young, Charles Earland ,Kenny Burrell, Grant Green, Wes Montgomery, Curtis Mayfield, James Brown and Prince.

We play a mixture of my own original compositions as well as arrangements from jazz compositions, tunes from the American Songbook, and arrangements from Motown and Soul. 

This will be  my first record as a band leader, as well as the debut album of this project. My goal is to record and release the album in early 2021. Your contributions will help me share my music and vision with people all over the world. Moreover, it will give me the chance to tour more widely once that's possible again.

What We Need & What You Get

The record will have eight tracks and will feature special guests.

Here is an estimated breakdown of costs:

  • Recording: 1500 Euros
  • Mixing/Mastering: 1000 Euros
  • CD/Vinyl Pressing: 1000 Euros
  • Artwork: 500 Euros
  • Travel: 500 Euros
  • Videoshooting/Editing: 1000 Euros
  • Unforseen:  500 Euros

Total: 6000 Euros

For those of you interested in supporting the project, you can donate any amount. You can also can contribute specific amounts to receive the following perks:

  • 10 Euros - Digital Download (WAV Quality)
  • 20 Euros - CD + Digital Download
  • 35 Euros - Vinyl + Digital Download
  • 50 Euros - CD + Vinyl+Digital Download
  • 80 Euros - CD + Digital Download + an online Guitar Lesson (for musicians)/Zoom meeting with the band (for non-musicians)
  • 100 Euros - CD + Digital Download+ a "behind the scenes" video of the recoding procedure
  • 300 Euros - CD + Digital Download + a private concert (only in Greece) or a private online concert 

The Impact

As we're all aware, 2020 was a really difficult year.

However, even under these extreme circumstances, we all turned to art in one form or another (music, books, movies, television, etc.) to ease the journey.

By supporting this project, you're helping me share my music with people all over the world, and to grow my audience.

    Risks & Challenges

    With your support, I will be able to afford the production quality I feel this project deserves. The funding from this campaign will also make it possible to produce CDs and vinyl copies in order to bring my music into your homes.

    Your support will also make it possible to feature additional guest musicians, which will contribute to the unique sound of the album.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you cannot donate, your help is always valuable.

    You can share this campaign or subscribe and share my YouTube page 'Iakovos Symeonidis', or use the tried and tested method of telling your friends and family.

    I would love to meet some of you at our up-coming perfomances, whether in person or virtually.

story:
On the right you can preorder the book and get discounts, perks and goodies.

Pick your Perk!

 

Hi, I'm Ari

 

I'm a busy and versatile bassist, passionate educator, and bass blogger.

Teaching music is my passion. When I am not playing the bass myself, you will no doubt find me working with my students, leading my bass practice groups, blogging about bass topics, or creating bass courses for my own platform and many other awesome ones - such as Scott's Bass Lessons, TrueFire and notreble.com. 

I am also an author - my first book, Music Theory for the Bass Player - a Comprehensive Guide to Playing with More Confidence and Freedom -  is a frequent bestseller on Amazon in its category. It continues to sell thousands of copies each year, has a 5-star rating, and hundreds of awesome reviews.

 

My first book was a huge success because it flowed from observing my students' asks very closely. 

Screenshot from March 2021

 

I observe my students very closely and come up with creative ways to help them reach the music inside of themselves. I have developed several programs over the years and they get consistent results. 

I am no fan of gimmicks or mindless practice

Short-cuts or quick fixes sound tempting but they likely won't get you very far.

On the other hand, spending hours and hours playing boring scales or reading down pages and pages of arpeggios likely gives your fingers a bit of a payoff but you probably won't feel none the wiser afterward.

A better way...

My solid, proven methods are engaging because you create your own grooves. You improvise. You are deeply involved creating rather than just re-creating. And that's why it clicks. And sticks! And then it's yours and there is no more satisfying feeling in the world!

My first book was about Music Theory for the Bass Player. You explore the patterns of music and what they look like (and feel like and sound like!) on the bass.   

My New Book

My first book was all about Music Theory for the Bass Player. It explored the patterns of music and what they look like (and feel like and sound like!) on the fretboard.   

The Pattern System for the Bass Player - Sharpen Your Musical Mind through Fretboard Proficiency, Improvisation, and Mental Practice. 

 

My second book takes this pattern-based approach several steps further. I wrote it along with my partner and teacher Wolfgang Wein. It teaches a solid method of learning the fretboard by going through all the major scales, diatonic triads. pentatonics, common chord progressions... 

And we go far beyond that

  • We dive into the beautiful study of the patterns of music itself, not just the fretboard. And we learn them in such a way that you can play with complete freedom.
  • No more chasing notes.
  • No more poking around hoping to play what you are hearing inside.
  • Gain a solid command of the fretboard.
  • Visualize shapes and patterns and then improvise freely within them at first, then beyond.
  • And we show you how to practice effectively… including mental practice, and meditational approaches.
  • Jam with us! Improvisation helps make the learnings stick!

  • Scalar studies (to get your fingers and technique in top shape)

 

I worked for five years on this book. It uses time-tested methods combined with innovative learning techniques. It puts the student in the driver's seat. 

It's a rigorous program - and one I have gone through with hobbyists and pros alike. You’ll get what you put in, but I can promise you that even if you put in a little bit, you’ll get a lot out of it. 

Educators and academics will appreciate the well-thought-out layout and flow of the program and pacing, as well as the quiz-able Blueprints and the Test Questions.   

 

Five years to write - 20+ years to validate and fine-tune

  • I know this method works, because I’ve seen it first hand with my students.

  • This method has helped both me and Wolf on our paths (we kept testing out of university classes all the time!) and we developed it further with great care. 

  • My blog readers and subscribers constantly ask about it and when it will be available!

  • Readers, bass friends, and associates have come out of the woodwork to support us through this process. It has buoyed us whenever the nights were long (too many to count) or the computer crashed (even machines get tired!).

 

A Team (The A-Team!)

I have had an incredible team alongside me on this journey  without whose help this book would not have been possible:

  • A hugely experienced book designer
  • An amazing cover designer
  • Two tireless editors 
  • A designer with an amazing sense of humor 
  • Videographers and video editors
  • Consulting, legal, and accounting awesomeness (they are all musicians as well, too!)

We also had incredible bassists and reviewers read through the text and check the diagrams to help us out. This kind of support (and belief in the book) is invaluable!

 

Your Super Hero Sidekick

Because this is a big book I felt you needed a partner on your path to becoming a fretboard hero. Enter is Skippy, a vintage metronome with a bit of an attitude:

 


At times light-hearted, ee is also full of wisdom:

 

 

And he keeps it real...

 

 

What are we Funding?

1 - Funding The Team

Funding the A-Team above for their invaluable contributions

2 - Spiral-bound Prints

This book is well over 300 pages. You will want to work with it on your music stand. Spiral binding allows the book to lay flat!

As a perk for supporters, we are selling the first 500 books as spiral-bound copies.

We have a printer with a fulfillment center right next to it! Lucky are we, as we know what a beautiful job they did with our first book! 

3 - Additional Study Materials

After my first book came out I received many emails from readers requesting encores on the topics of this book. So Wolf and I created associated courses, a wall chart, and now also Practice Groups. For this new book we are also creating additional - and optional - study guides.   All of which do not come without a (significant) cost.

4 - The Videos

This book comes with 111 videos that demonstrate the exercises described. We needed editors, videographers, a video consultant (also a musician!), and lots of hard drive space!

5 - The Wall Chart

If you get the book, likely you will also want the beautiful wall chart! It is optional - but a great addition to your practice room wall! It is beautifully designed and much larger than our first wall chart! And it contains all the sequences and patterns you need for this method. Always a great refresher at-a-glance!

 

6 - Practice Groups

Practice Groups on the Pattern System are already up and running. We filled the first group straight away!

 

The Impact

Many books have been written on fretboard harmony, but just like with my first book, I wrote it because I saw nothing with the same concept on the market. 

My theory book was unique in that it teaches theory on the bass fretboard through diagrams (diagrams and understanding first, reading later!).

This method is unique in that it combines tried-and-tested fretboard harmony drills with mental practice, improvisation, and deep student engagement. It is practical and applicable while stimulating your creativity and understanding of music!

 

Risks & Challenges

Just like my first book, I gave it my all. I didn't spare a penny or cut a corner.  It was a big risk then, and an even bigger risk now. 

But this is no longer my first book! I can now confidently say that I am an experienced self-publisher - so I know the commitment, the challenges, the responsibility. And the many many hours of marketing and distribution work that awaits us here.      

I have done my homework and I feel ready and confident that this book will be well received and that the campaign will be fully funded.

And then there are many blog readers and fans who have written to me asking when - o when - they can finally order. It's been a long wait. Now the wait is over!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute right now, but there are other meaningful ways to lend your support:

  • Know any bass players? Tell 'em!
  • Any bass educators in your life? Share our campaign with them!

The Indiegogo share tools make this very easy and we are very grateful for your support!

 

Perks

All the books you will get through this campaign will be spiral-bound. Copies available on Amazon will only be perfect bound.

From Skippy T-Shirt swag to book/course/wallchart packages, signed copies, and other goodies, you have lots of options and levels of support. 

And we will have some fun, too! We will do polls and give-aways and I will tell you the story about the beautiful basses on the covers! 

 

Please join us!

story:
M I N T

HELLO!

I'm MIKAIL - a vocalist & singer/songwriter from the Midwest :)

I've been told I sound like, or have similar vocal nuances to: Stevie Wonder, Sam Smith, Rufus Wainwright, Chad Petree, Rob Swire & JC Chasez.

Sonically? my dream sound is Goldfrapp meets KPOP meets a winter Windham Hill compilation (if you can hear this, welcome friend!), but an easier explanation would be to use the word "electronic" followed by pop, alternative, dance, instrumental. As the lead vocalist of Homeboi, I took a more R&B/alt rock influence, and as featured vocalist on The Backlit Infinite (Minneapolis based synthwave) - definitely a more simplified, upfront pop approach! Please check out my music at the link included to see what I'm about!

https://linktr.ee/mikailxxmusic

 

As some of you may remember, January 2020 I announced 'Mint Season' was beginning - three singles leading to my first full length solo album. I was making plans for music videos, branding for live shows summer of '20 with this material as this was going to be my official debut as a solo artist, Mikail.

Well, a month later rumors of a virus spread and another month later it was full blown and has reached every nook and cranny that is possibly could in our society. This literally blew to smithereens all my plans as no one really had a for sure idea what was going on.

October last year, I still wanted to finish the year strong as I had still been writing & recording demos, but also wanted a Christmas album under my belt. Many of you helped fund THAT Indiegogo campaign which was an incredible feeling. Artistically, there could not have been a better end to my year.

Since then, I have released two more albums as I needed to ride this wave of momentum and continue building my library. However, the time has come for me to ask again if you would like to be an even bigger part of my music journey.

MINT will now be my 4th solo album, but really what I have been working and building towards as an artist since day 1. I have tried to step up my game with each release, and this will be no different for MINT - in fact, I think many will be surprised with everything I am planning for these songs. The scope, the range of emotion, full display of my creative artistry - I am aiming for something greater than I even initially dreamed for this album. 

The goal is to release the album via streaming on midnight of my birthday this year - December 16th, with a physical copy not far behind. While most of the writing and some other work is already done, this is not a lot of time for arranging, production, recording, mixing/mastering, photoshoots, CD duplication, etc.,.

I understand more than you know that times are hard, and it is not easy to give - much less to someone trying to make an album happen. But I would add - picture your life right now without music, without movies or television streaming to take you away, without books or video games to educate & destress. All of these things are arts, and while I know not all music is for everyone - my goal is to reach listeners and make a difference. Turn up the volume in the car, the shower, the dancefloor, in bed after a breakup - I want to make people feel.

Even if you are not able to give, it would mean the world to me to listen and review, comment or drop me a message with your thoughts on my music - even a request or a thought that comes to you while listening to Mikail. That's still exactly what I am looking for in the end.

Thank you for reading this far - I truly appreciate it.

 

xx mikail

story:
Note from Jason Narducy (Split Single, Bob Mould Band, Superchunk):

I am excited to be starting a new album (our third!) here in Chicago! There are a number of basic costs to making an album and that's why we are here offering cool perks to those who want to contribute.

Where does this money go? There are studio and engineer fees, mixing and mastering costs, manufacturing of vinyl and CDs, and publicity. For a project like Split Single there are a lot of people working for free or for a very reduced rate. We are a small rock band, and these favors are VERY MUCH appreciated and, honestly, necessary for continued creation. 

As some of you know, I release these albums out of my basement. There is no label, no manager, no booking agent. It's often me and my kids stuffing vinyl into cardboard boxes and applying postage and labels and then walking to the post office to deliver. We have a great time doing this, but my point is this is a small operation. 

I'm excited to share these new songs with you, and I think we have put together some cool, unique perks for this crowdfunding campaign. Some of them are very LIMITED so please don't wait. I will post pictures and videos from the studio to keep all supporters up to date on progress. We are working toward a spring 2020 release.

If you have any questions about the campaign or about basketball, beer, or the genius of Cheap Trick, you can email me at jasonsplitsingle@gmail.com.

THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR CHECKING OUT THIS PROJECT!!!!

Jason Narducy

Evanston, IL

story:
Project Summary:

I am putting out a full-length album this summer as The Sizzos titled She’s Driving Down! 

Sizzos is a word my son coined when he first started talking to ubiquitously stand in for “I don’t know.” This project is all about that leap of faith into something unknown and an attempt to understand and connect better to music, myself, the experiences of being a dad, a son, a partner, and to you all - my friends and family.  

My first memories of vinyl records center around listening to either Joan Jett and the Blackhearts, Toto IV, or Sesame Street on my Fisher Price record player tucked back into the far corner of my childhood room. It felt special and like I was in on a secret. I was! 

The summer after college, I committed to teaching myself how to play guitar, which was always something I NEVER thought I would be able to do. Well, almost immediately after learning a few chords, I started writing songs. It was a passion from the jump. 

Now, over 20 years later, I’m finally doing something else I never thought I could do: put out an album of my songs written to be recorded as a vinyl time capsule. I’m not doing it alone though as multiple friends/musicians appear on She’s Driving Down too. I’m so thankful for the inspiration, companionship, and collaboration. 

While this album was started before the pandemic and the protests for racial equity in 2020, this album no doubt is influenced by both. These songs are stories about navigating the differences between perception and reality, whether in ourselves, our connections, or in the world around us. These songs are stories about overcoming fear, shame, and insecurity in search of deep love, joy, and relationships that we can depend on. 

By supporting this effort, you are helping me achieve an almost-lifelong goal, a dream really. Like working for any goal or dreaming any dream, this has been hard work, immensely rewarding, and a more than a bit f&$%ing scary! That’s how I know it’s all worth it. 

Thanks for being on this journey with me.

What I Need:

It is not good enough for me to do what I’ve always done in the past...write songs and be too scared to refine and share them or just play them live in a bar once a year. To turn this effort into something lasting (one of more to come I hope!), I need to go through the process of making this album a record. Here’s what it entails and what your support will help me do. 

  • Creating: This part is already done! Demos were recorded in our basement in Portland, OR. There are enough songs to get started on the next album too.
  • Mixing: Erik Walker at Wacko World Music in San Francisco, CA will bring his amazing ear and no-nonsense sensibility to the mix of the songs. I’ve known Erik since we were neighbors and even got to play with him a few times. This will happen in April. 
  • Pre-mastering: Thomas Dimuzio of Gench Music will do the premastering to get Erik’s mixes ready for both a vinyl edition and a digital one on Bandcamp. Hopefully this can get turned around in early May. 
  • Mastering: Jon Niess of Austin Signal in Austin, TX will take the tracks and work them so they are in vinyl format. He will also print the artwork/jackets too! Hopefully, before Memorial Day, I will send the tracks to Austin.
  • Plating and Pressing: Jon will work with Record Technologies, Inc. in Camarillo, CA to take the “mother” vinyl and turn that into the 20 records I have for all of you. If all goes well, I could get a box of records shipped to me sometime around my 45th birthday in July!

What You Get:

Besides being more influential than you already are in making this project a reality, you will get some/all of the following:

  • Digital download of the album from Bandcamp
  • Your name and/or a personal thank you in the digital liner notes on Bandcamp
  • One of 20 vinyl copies of the album
  • Personal thank you on the album liner notes on the back of the record jacket
  • Collaborating with me on a song for the next album
  • A song for you and/or a loved one
  • Hugs, high fives, gratitude!

The Impact:

The process of writing songs and recording them is a true passion of mine, and I want this to be just the start of this path for me. I’m hoping that this experience will inspire to continue making music and sharing it with people I love. Maybe there is something in the songs that will resonate with you or others too. Maybe you are also on a journey of discovery, understanding, and/or creativity and this will help you see that you aren’t alone and you can do it too. Because if I can make this dream come true, one that seemed impossible to me, then you can turn your ideas into reality too. 

In addition, I will be donating 25% of sales from my Bandcamp site to two incredible organizations in Portland I connect with as part of my work life that are actively, intentionally, and authentically creating access to equity and music. I encourage you to also help support them if you can.

  • Albina Music Trust documents the historic music culture of Portland’s Albina District through oral history, media archivism, and events.
  • Friends of Noise supports creative youth in Portland through all ages concerts, workshops, and experience navigating the music scene.

Finally, there will be another record. This will help me create momentum for songwriting as a thing I do and will continue to do!    

Risks:

There is a chance that there will be bumps and delays along the way in the process I outlined above. If so, I will continue to communicate and let you know what has changed and when you can expect it to all be completed.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren’t able or don’t want to contribute to this, no problem at all. You can still spread the word of this album and campaign to people you think might dig it. I would so appreciate that! 

  • Click on the new Insta and Bandcamp sites and you can follow this project and share it with others. 
  • And, not leaving any stone unturned, I'm selling some of the records from my collection to help cover the costs of making this album. If you'd like to support me that way, here's my "store".
